jobs.title: Advisory Board Member || US Resident
jobs.description:
Are you a visionary thinker and a software passionate?

Are you excited about Software Delivery and Operations Management? If so, we want to hear from you.

WideXP is an Engineering Company focused on delivering tailored technology strategies for small and medium-sized businesses. With a high reputation in information technology solutions, we specialize in automotive software, military embedded systems, medical equipment, QA automation services, mobile software services, recruiting and HR, and project management. We value competence, collaboration, simplicity, and community in our culture.

We are constantly growing with the help of our clients and partners, and we are driven by the desire to improve our company's performance. For more information, please contact us at contact@widexp.com.

We pride ourselves on our ability to provide technical solutions to our customers.

We're searching for a high-level Partner to join our leadership board—someone ready to build, own, and scale a sales and growth engine from the ground up.

This is not a job opening; it’s a call to co-create.

**Our services:**

* Automotive Software
* Military Embedded Systems
* Medical equipment
* QA Automation Services
* Mobile Software Services
* Recruiting and HR.
* Project Management.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Provide strategic guidance and independent perspective on company direction, growth, and key initiatives.
* Offer industry insights and help identify market opportunities or risks.
* Advise leadership on business development, partnerships, and scaling strategies.
* Leverage professional network to open doors for collaborations, clients, or investors.
* Participate in regular advisory meetings (quarterly or as needed) to review performance and major decisions.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven executive or senior leadership experience
* Strong track record in business growth, partnerships, or strategy execution.
* Demonstrated expertise in the relevant industry (technology, consulting, or related field).
* Excellent strategic thinking, communication, and relationship-building skills.
* Ability to contribute time periodically for meetings, reviews, or introductions.
* High integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.
* (Optional) Experience serving on advisory or non-executive boards.

**We Value:**

* Multiple perspectives
* Global connections
* Tolerance
* Respect for others
* Diversity
* Innovation
* Cultural understanding
* Learning by doing
* Engaged citizenship

**Location:**

* This role is open to candidates across the U.S.
* Remote

**Referrals:**

* If you know someone who is perfect for this role, tell us about them!

**Job Function:**

* Executive

**Contact:**

* contact@widexp.com

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100.00 - $300.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Chief Financial Officer – Construction | General Contractor Dallas, Texas
jobs.description:
We are currently seeking an accomplished Chief Financial Officer to oversee and direct the financial leadership of our rapidly expanding construction management and general contracting organization based in Dallas, TX. This role is designed for a forward-thinking finance executive who can provide strategic direction while maintaining strong financial discipline as the company scales.

Reporting directly to the President, the CFO will be a trusted partner to senior leadership, responsible for safeguarding the company’s financial strength, improving operational performance, and supporting sustained profitability across complex construction projects.

This is a full-time, on-site role in Dallas. Relocation support is available for qualified candidates nationwide.

Equity Participation

The position offers equity participation tied to development projects, presenting a compelling opportunity for a finance leader who wants long-term upside and a meaningful role in shaping the future of a growing construction enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

Provide executive-level financial leadership across budgeting, forecasting, banking relationships, insurance, audits, tax compliance, and internal controls

Work closely with ownership and executive management to align financial strategy with business growth and operational goals

Lead, develop, and mentor accounting and finance teams while ensuring accuracy, compliance, and best-in-class financial practices

Partner with project teams, clients, and vendors to support contract administration, cash flow management, and financial performance on major construction and infrastructure projects

Advance financial reporting and systems by implementing modern tools that support real-time analysis and data-driven decision making

Qualifications & Ideal Background

10–20 years of progressive accounting and finance experience within the construction industry

Demonstrated stability and leadership within a construction organization (General Contractor, Construction Manager, EPC, Design-Build, Civil, or Specialty Contractor)

Proven success managing financial operations, controls, and strategy in a project-based environment

Strong expertise in financial planning, job cost accounting, audits, tax matters, and ERP/accounting platforms

Excellent leadership, communication, and analytical capabilities

Open to seasoned CFOs or senior Controllers / Vice Presidents of Finance prepared to step into a top executive role

Confidential Search

All discussions, inquiries, and candidate information will be handled with strict confidentiality.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $250,000.00 - $300,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Relocation assistance

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Fractional CFO - Remote
jobs.description:
Join a fast‑growing fractional CFO firm supporting small and mid‑sized businesses. We’re seeking an experienced, client‑facing Fractional CFO to lead financial operations, deliver clear insights, and guide business owners on budgeting, forecasting, and cash‑flow strategy. This role is remote with periodic on‑site client visits.

No business development required — clients are assigned directly to you. Your focus is delivering exceptional financial leadership, not selling or sourcing new accounts. Clients are brought to you by leadership and the business development team. If you choose to pursue your own BD efforts, you are welcome to do so but it is not required.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage financial analysis, reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and cash‑flow planning for assigned clients
* Serve as the primary financial advisor to business owners; review financials monthly
* Review and validate team‑prepared financial deliverables for accuracy and quality
* Build financial models for forecasting, budgeting, and scenario planning
* Identify opportunities to improve profitability and cash flow
* Translate financial data into actionable recommendations for business owners
* Advise on capital structure, growth planning, and risk management
* Collaborate with accountants, attorneys, bankers, and internal team members
* Support client financing needs with knowledge of commercial lending structures
* Maintain documentation, timelines, and client communication

**Workload Expectations**

* Manage approximately 6–10 clients with team support
* Client retainers typically range from 10–20 hours per month
* Core client size ranges from $5 million to $100 million in annual revenue

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related field
* 5+ years in a Finance Manager, Controller, Consultant, or similar client‑facing role
* Experience in banking, finance, or accounting
* C&I banking experience is a plus

**Preferred Skills**

* Strong strategic financial acumen
* Financial process improvement experience
* Excellent communication and client‑facing skills

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chicago, IL 60610

jobs.title: Retail Sales & Recruiting Support Specialist (Advisory)
jobs.description:
###### **Department**

Sales

###### **Classification**

Non-Exempt

###### **Location**

Carpinteria Headquarters, On-site

###### **Position Type**

Full Time

#### **Description**

As the ***Retail Sales & Recruiting Support Specialist,*** you have the role of supporting VP of Retail Sales and Advisory Recruiting teams with various projects and tasks related to advisor and Financial Center recruiting.

**Location Information:** On-Site at our Carpinteria, CA Headquarters

**Salary Range:** Starting salary is between $62,000 and $68,000 annually, with the possibility of future incentive compensation based on growth in sales. It is ultimately determined by the scope of the position the candidate’s relevant experience, credentials/certifications and internal equity. We offer a generous compensation package that includes an attractive benefits package with medical, dental and vision, 401k company match, discretionary profit sharing, PTO, valet parking and more.

#### **Responsibilities**

* Event Planning & Production
* Assist with training & mentoring new employees on the Recruiting team
* Proficient with LinkedIn marketing needs and prospecting campaigns
* Coordinate prospective Financial Centers/Financial Advisors information form for each call/meeting w/ Partner Dev Rep (PDR)
* Manage all prospecting seminars/webinars
* Manage the RIMS system for Recruiting
* Prepares meeting/event agendas
* Coordinate w/ Partner Development Reps on recruit materials
* Be familiar with commission payout system
* Coordinate/host Home Office Visits for recruit’s w/ PDR’s
* Manage recruit data base, Weekly Dashboard Reports
* Know all relevant company sales literature and provide feedback
* Know the PlanMember sales story and be able to communicate this to recruits
* Assist in implementation of master recruiting plan for 40+ FC’s Nationwide
* Help coordinate/manage the relationship – meetings between Marketing, Transitions and Recruiting
* Strategic Scheduling & Prioritization
* Vendor Administration
* Process & Program Development
* Prospect Strategy Support
* Technology Training & maintenance
* Analyze prospecting trends using Salesforce & Redtail
* Onboarding & Transitioning all new Advisors
* Managing Pipelines and sales calendars/tasks
* Creates and maintains CRM Sales reports
* Create sales ideas and content
* Analyzes advisors Broker Check to determine Compliance viability
* Attend & maintain agenda for Advisory council meetings
* Review, present & Process contracts & legal documents for Financial Centers

#### **Qualifications**

***Competencies Required:***

**Active Communication**

* + Proven verbal/written communication/presentation skills
  + Influential and persuasive

**Interpersonal Dynamics:**

* Ability to work well in a one on one and a team environment
* Relationship building
* Professional
* Positive attitude
* Diplomatic

**Information Seeking**

**Managing Processes**  

* Time management/well organized

**Self-Management:**  

* Ability to work independently without close supervision
* Ability to prioritize and execute on multiple tasks
* Composure and resiliency
* Leadership Skills

#### **Education**

* Be proficient with Word, PowerPoint, Excel
* Having a working knowledge of database management (Salesforce), or FINTRX is desired
* Bachelor’s Degree Preferred
* Two years of experience with a Financial Services Firm

***Licenses and/or Certifications Required***  
None

***Additional License and/or Certification Information***  
Be willing to obtain SIE, Series 6 or 7 (preferred), if not currently held.  
For advancement, Series 6 or 7 is required

jobs.title: Cybersecurity Intern (Part-Time)
jobs.description:
**Position Overview:**

The Cybersecurity Intern will assist in the proactive administration and maintenance of global IT security including security configuration, patching, and deployment and carrying out security measures to monitor, alert and protect sensitive data and systems from internal/external threats, infiltration and cyber-attacks.

**Responsibilities:**

* Regularly gather cybersecurity metrics from the tools and maintain the records on SharePoint.

* Assist with SharePoint permission audit.

* Review user information fields in KnowBe4 and update them as necessary, including VP details.

* Update the contractor's manager details in AD.

* Keep the third-party risk assessment register up-to-date on the SharePoint site with past and current risk assessment outcomes.

* Document all Cisco ESA Policies, Content filter rules and message filters for future reference.

* Document all the Transport rules we have in Office 365 and work on cleaning those up after gaining approval through the proper change process.

* Document Cybersecurity processes, procedures and guidelines

* Contribute to projects that enhance the security posture of the enterprise.

* Develop and maintain reports and dashboards for reporting on KPIs on security awareness, threats, and events.

* Creates and maintains security specific documentation.

* Provides additional IT infrastructure support and project assistance as required

**Qualifications:**

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Foundational understanding of IT concepts, including computer networks, operating systems, software, and hardware.
* Basic familiarity with web and email security concepts (e.g., phishing, spam filtering, secure browsing).
* Exposure to anti-virus tools and/or Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solutions through coursework, labs, or internships.
* General knowledge of common cybersecurity principles and technical security controls.
* Strong oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to explain basic security concepts and potential risks clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow in a fast-paced security environment.

jobs.title: Client Experience & Assistant to the Vice President ( Part-time)
jobs.description:
**About Us**

Ashton Pools By Design is Delaware’s leading design-build pool company, known for high-quality work and a warm, professional client experience. Our design studio is the heart of our business, and we’re looking for a **highly competent, friendly, tech-savvy onsite assistant** to help keep daily operations running smoothly.

**Overview**  
Join our dynamic team as a part-time Client Experience & Administrative Assistant to anchor the midday-to-afternoon studio hours. You'll ensure the studio remains staffed, organized and welcoming for our clients. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves providing exceptional customer service, and enjoys keeping office operations running smoothly. You’ll be the friendly face and efficient support system that ensures clients feel valued and internal processes are seamlessly managed. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a vibrant workplace while honing your administrative expertise in a supportive setting. This is ideal for someone who prefers a steady, predictable daytime schedule.

**Duties**

**Client & Design Studio Support**

* Greet clients, visitors, and team members with professionalism and warmth at the front desk, creating a welcoming environment.
* Manage multi-line phone systems, answer inquiries promptly, and direct calls accurately to ensure smooth communication flow.
* Maintain a clean, polished and organized design studio
* Keep brochures, materials and signage stocked and updated
* Order fresh flowers weekly
* Update and program t
* Help manage walk-in clients (15-minute limit, then schedule a follow-up)he outdoor digital sign
* Cover the design studio reliably during afternoon hours

**Administrative & Scheduling Support**

* Manage the calendars of the Vice President & President
* Enter new leads into HubSpot accurately
* Load client/project information into JobTread
* Prepare client folders and meeting materials
* Schedule meetings for leadership
* Track and organize the owner’s daily calendar
* Help coordinate site visits for team members
* Maintain filing systems (paper + digital)
* Order office supplies and manage inventory

**Studio & Marketing Support (Basic Tech Tasks)**

* Make simple updates in Canva (signs, announcements, reminders)
* Post basic social media updates using templates + guidance
* Keep studio messaging consistent and up-to-date

**Team & Operations Support**

* Assist with employee meetings (agendas, attendance, signs, food orders)
* Communicate proactively with sales, design, and operations
* Anticipate needs and address issues before they escalate

**Skills & Qualifications**

* Comfortable talking with clients and speaking off the cuff
* Professional, confident phone presence
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* Tech-comfortable: Google Workspace, HubSpot, JobTread (training provided)
* Comfortable with basic Canva tasks
* Reliable and able to work independently
* Prior administrative or client-facing experience preferred

**Hours & Compensation**

* **24 hours/week (Mon/Tue/Thu/Fri — 10:30 to 4:30)**
* Fully onsite — **not a remote or hybrid role**
* Paid training
* Competitive hourly rate based on experience
* Additional hours possible during peak season

**Why This Role Works Well for the Right Person**

* Predictable daytime schedule (Wednesdays off)
* A beautiful design studio environment
* A stable role with meaningful responsibilities
* You are the anchor of the client experience each afternoon
* A small, supportive team where your work genuinely matters

Pay: $22.00 - $24.00 per hour

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* Executive administrative support: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft Office: 3 years (Required)
* CRM software: 3 years (Required)
* HubSpot: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer relationship management: 3 years (Required)
* Canva: 1 year (Preferred)
* Google Workspace: 1 year (Preferred)
* Calendar management: 3 years (Required)
* Phone etiquette: 3 years (Required)
* Marketing: 2 years (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Rehoboth Beach, DE 19971 (Required)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Executive Partner - Enterprise Architecture & Innovation - Advisory for Global Enterprise Leaders
jobs.description:
**Enterprise IT Leaders – Executive Partner Role – Enterprise Architecture and Innovation**

**Opening statement** Gartner is a people business. Fueled by expert analysis, bold ideas and intellectual courage, we are a team of thinkers, doers, and lifelong learners. We are innately curious, driven, disciplined and humble.

**The Team and Leader Statement**

Enterprise IT Leaders (EITL) is an executive-level advisory service that delivers expert insight and guidance tailored to each member's context and most critical initiatives. EITL consists of 7 areas of expertise (domains) that cover several areas within IT: Applications, Data & Analytics, Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure & Operations, Program & Portfolio Management, Security & Risk, Sourcing & Vendor Management.

Gartner’s Executive Partners team consists of 178 Executive Partners globally who specialize in one of the 7 domain areas and equip business leaders with indispensable insights, advice and tools to achieve their mission-critical priorities today and build the successful organizations of tomorrow. Our Associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional career development as well as unlimited growth potential. If you like working with a generous, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is where you want to be.

**Job description**

* You will manage a portfolio of 28-30 clients, typically Enterprise Architecture & Innovation leaders reporting to CIOs, from global Fortune 100 – 500 organizations
* As their Executive Partner, you will be delivering value through regular briefings, on-site workshops, roundtables, webinars and by attending relevant Gartner events, etc.
* As someone who has previously been in their shoes before, you will use your knowledge and expertise, along with additional Gartner resources and research, to coach and mentor your clients on critical initiatives and challenges for today and tomorrow specifically within the EA space.
* Collaboration is key. You will work closely with several internal Gartner teams to ensure value is delivered. These can include Sales teams, Analysts, Client Managers, and your peers across other EITL domains.
* This role is a Client-facing position that requires a high level of Executive presence and ability to build trust and deliver value.
* Responsible for member retention and for contributing toward growth in the region through direct support of Gartner Sales in prospect cultivation, account plan development and value demonstration activities.
* This is a predominantly home-based role, where you will operate as an individual contributor managing your own desk and other administrative tasks, i.e. expense reports, meetings.

**Essential must-have skills**

We’d love to talk to you if you have:

* 15+ years’ experience with a primary focus in an executive Enterprise Architecture leader role such as Chief Enterprise Architect, Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Chief Innovation Officer, Chief Technologist, Chief Strategist, Head of Innovation Lab within a Fortune 500 company.
* Experience in executive level roles within consulting, sales or customer facing positions.
* Ability to be viewed as a credible peer of their global enterprise clients given their career experience gained.
* Modern technical skills and subject matter expertise in the following areas:

Enterprise Architecture (EA)

* Building and leading an effective business outcome driven EA program
* Business, information, technology and solutions architecture
* Federated enterprise architecture in larger organizations
* EA governance
* EA in a highly outsourced IT structure
* Cloud architecture
* Architecting platforms (think Amazon, eBay, Uber, etc as business enabling platforms)

Innovation Leadership/Management

* Creating a culture of innovation
* Funding – internal or external VC
* Ideation, transfer & incubation
* Prototypes & pilots
* Technology tracking, scenario planning, horizon scanning
* Innovation metrics and maturity – measuring innovation effectiveness and business impact
* Innovation frameworks
* Business & reverse innovation

Emerging Trends

* Business, Social and Technology trends and creative application of them to create business advantage
* Industry Impacts, breadth of application and non-adoption risk
* Product development life cycle

Digital Business/Government, Transformation, Strategic Planning

* Digital Business/Government strategy and roadmap – applying new, digitally enabled business models
* Traditional business and IT strategic planning
* People-Process-Technology transformation

* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree required

**Benefits** We offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including Company benefits including full medical, dental, and vision starting day one, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, wellness rewards, 25 days of paid time-off, etc. Gartner is a high growth company which will provide the right candidate with a wealth of career development opportunities. All Gartner associates strive on being high performers, problem solvers, team players with passion, integrity and effectiveness. We strive to attract exceptional people who really enjoy what they do. Are you ready to jump on board?

**Equality statement** The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, caste, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Gartner affirmatively seeks to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity and values diversity and inclusion.

Gartner is an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified applicant with a disability and unable to or limited in your ability to use or access the Gartner’s career webpage as a result of your disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1203-964-0096 or by sending an email to Applicant.Assistance@gartner.com

#LI-MB2

**Who are we?**

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**

Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

**What do we offer?**

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 160,000 USD - 194,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.

jobs.title: Fractional CFO
jobs.description:
**About Us:**

Indinero is a leading financial operations company dedicated to empowering businesses with comprehensive back-office solutions. Our mission is to help businesses make smarter financial decisions by offering a full suite of services, including bookkeeping, tax preparation, and CFO advisory. At Indinero, we believe in fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and client-centricity. We're committed to delivering exceptional value to our clients while creating a dynamic and rewarding environment for our team members. As we continue to grow and evolve, we seek passionate professionals who share our vision of transforming how businesses manage their finances. Join us in making financial clarity accessible to every ambitious company.

**Job Summary:** The Fractional CFO provides strategic financial leadership and advisory services to our clients, helping them drive growth, improve profitability, and strengthen financial operations. This role also plays a critical part in supporting the growth and development of the CFO practice within the firm. The Fractional CFO collaborates closely with client leadership, internal Controllers, and other CFOs to ensure consistent service delivery, effective reporting, and the highest level of client satisfaction. Exceptional communication skills, strategic thinking, and a proactive approach to problem-solving are essential to success in this role.

**Essential Job Duties:**

* Deliver Executive-level CFO advisory services to clients, including financial strategy, forecasting, scenario planning, cash flow optimization. and other services included in the standard scope of work
* Collaborate with internal or external Controllers to improve reporting to ensure clients receive high quality financial information that aligns and supports strategic initiatives
* Support the growth of the CFO practice by:
  + Engaging in new business opportunities and client upsells.
  + Mentoring and upskilling other CFOs within the firm.
  + Ensuring consistent messaging and approach across the practice.
  + Contributing to the development and standardization of service delivery models.
  + Participating in training sessions for personal skill improvement.
* Communicate effectively with clients, internal teams, and leadership, translating complex financial information into actionable insights.
* Identify opportunities to improve client outcomes and proactively recommend solutions.
* Actively participate in internal initiatives aimed at enhancing operational efficiency, team collaboration, and knowledge sharing across the practice.

**Required Job Skills:**

* Proven experience as a CFO or senior finance executive, ideally in advisory, consulting, or growth-stage business environments.
* Strong strategic thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
* Collaborative mindset, with experience working cross-functionally to drive results.
* Ability to mentor, coach, and upskill other finance professionals and seek personal growth opportunities.
* Comfortable managing multiple client engagements and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Demonstrated ability to standardize processes, improve reporting, and enhance overall service quality.
* Business development acumen, including supporting client acquisition and upsell initiatives.

**General Duties and Expectations**

  

* Create and maintain effective working relationships with other Company employees.
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
* Contribute to the professional culture within the office and the company overall.
* Project a professional and appropriate Company image in all dealings with clients, vendors, business partners and visitors.
* Ensure security of information in all matters pertaining to company, client, and consumer information
* Support the efforts of senior management and sales staff by maintaining business network of contacts as clients change roles and/or companies.
* Ability to work remotely.
* Ability to travel to attend meetings occasionally if needed.
* Contribute to the professional culture within the company.
* Adhere to the Company's Code of Conduct/Ethics and Core Values of One Team, Client Partnership and Direct Communication with Respect.

  

**What We Offer:**

• Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)  

* Retirement Plan (401k) with company match
* Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D) company paid
* Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
* Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)

* Short Term & Long Term Disability
* Work From Home
* Wellness Resources

jobs.title: CFO Advisory & Outsourcing - Partner
jobs.description:
**KLR is one of the largest full-service CPA and business advisory firms in New England and is ranked amongst the Top 100 firms in the United States. From our offices in Andover, Boston, Lausanne, Newport, and Providence, the 350+ person firm provides assurance, tax, and business advisory services to private and publicly-held companies throughout the United States and abroad. Recognized as a Best Place to Work for 19 years, KLR is committed to fostering a culture of collaboration, growth, and innovation.**

We are seeking our next Partner to lead our CFO Advisory & Outsourcing practice.

The CFO Advisory & Outsourcing practice is a cornerstone of the firm’s growth strategy. This group provides scalable finance solutions to privately held and middle-market businesses, spanning outsourced bookkeeping, controllership, and CFO advisory, as well as transaction readiness, succession planning, and value growth initiatives. Clients span a wide range of industries, including manufacturing and distribution, technology, professional services, hospitality, life science, construction and related industries, as well as non-profit organizations.

**Position Responsibilities:**

Strategic Leadership & Practice Growth:

* Lead the Outsourcing and Strategic CFO Services practice, establishing vision, strategy, and growth objectives aligned with firm goals.
* Drive expansion of the practice through new client acquisition, market positioning, and development of referral networks.
* Identify emerging market opportunities and service offerings to support continued growth and scalability.
* Represent the firm externally through professional networking, speaking engagements, and thought leadership initiatives.

Business Development & Relationship Management:

* Generate new business through personal and firm relationships, targeted prospecting, and collaboration with internal service lines.
* Build and maintain strategic referral relationships with commercial and investment bankers, attorneys, private equity firms, and wealth managers.
* Participate in proposal development, pricing, and client presentations to secure new engagements.
* Strengthen the firm’s marketplace presence within the outsourced accounting, CFO advisory, and consulting ecosystems.

Client Advisory & Engagement Delivery

* Serve as a trusted advisor and fractional CFO to privately held and growth-oriented businesses.
* Advise business owners and boards on financial strategy, value creation, succession planning, and governance matters.
* Oversee delivery of outsourced solutions ranging from staff augmentation to full CFO-level leadership.
* Guide clients through finance transformation initiatives, including process optimization, automation, and technology adoption.

Practice Management & Team Leadership

* Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing team of consultants and outsourced professionals.
* Ensure consistent, high-quality client service through standardized delivery models, best practices, and performance oversight.
* Implement scalable workflows, tools, and processes to improve efficiency, profitability, and client outcomes.
* Support recruiting, onboarding, performance management, and professional development within the practice.

Firm Collaboration & Leadership

* Collaborate with audit, tax, and advisory teams to deliver integrated, cross-functional client solutions.
* Contribute to firm leadership initiatives, strategic planning, and growth efforts.
* Promote a collaborative, entrepreneurial culture that aligns with the firm’s values and long-term vision.

**Other Duties:**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change from time to time with notice whenever possible, but not guaranteed.

**Position Qualifications:**

* 13-15+ years of progressive accounting, finance, or advisory experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership or partner-level role.
* Demonstrated success in business development within professional services.
* Hands-on experience as a fractional CFO, Controller, or senior finance leader for privately held or mid-market companies.
* Strong background in M&A advisory, succession planning, restructuring, and value growth strategies.
* Proven leadership experience in building and scaling practices, teams, and client portfolios.
* Industry experience in manufacturing, technology, distribution, hospitality, or related fields noted above strongly preferred.
* CPA preferred, MBA, or other advanced credential highly desirable.

This is a full-time position with standard hours of Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Additional hours, including some evenings and weekends, will be required during peak busy seasons.

**Pay Range:**

The salary range for this position is included below. Individual salaries within this range do not include benefits and bonus potential, and are determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education, knowledge, skills, and geographic location.

$190,000.00 - $230,000.00

**Benefits:**

KLR offers a wide range of benefits including: health and dental insurance, paid time-off and a competitive retirement savings plan. We offer tuition assistance, in-house education programs and offer employees opportunities for community involvement.

Come join a firm who has recently been recognized as a “Best Place to Work” for 19 years by the Providence Business Journal and voted as a Top 100 Firm in the country by Accounting Today!

KLR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Financial Officer
jobs.description:
**About us**

**Company Overview:**

**Le Dental Spa** is a boutique, patient-first dental practice that blends comprehensive dentistry with facial esthetics and wellness-focused care. Beyond delivering exceptional clinical outcomes, we operate with an elevated, hospitality-driven approach and a strong focus on intentional growth.

As a multi-service practice, our business includes a mix of clinical care, esthetic services, and long-term patient relationships, making thoughtful financial strategy, clear systems, and sustainable operations essential. This role supports the financial foundation that allows our team to deliver high-quality care while continuing to grow in a smart, balanced way.

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a **Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)** who wants to partner closely with the practice owner and the leadership team in supporting the financial health of the practice, the strength of the business, and the sustainability of our team.

This role is relationship-driven and collaborative by nature. The ideal candidate values long-term partnership, takes the time to understand how the business truly operates, and is committed to providing thoughtful, high-quality financial leadership. You’ll be responsible for bringing clarity to cash flow, profitability, and financial decision-making while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism, accuracy, and strategic thinking.

This is not a bookkeeping role. It’s a hands-on, strategic partnership focused on financial clarity, accountability, and building a strong financial foundation that supports exceptional patient care and long-term growth.

**Our Core Values**

At Le Dental Spa, our values epitomize our unwavering commitment to invigorating and energizing the experience. We infuse every aspect of our practice with our values: to be informed, innovative, and have integrity. We want to breath new life into the industry and the well-being of our patients.

***Informed***

*Our commitment to being informed drives us to provide the highest quality care, fostering a harmonious and supportive environment for our patients.*

***Innovative***

*Our commitment to be innovative means continually seeking the latest knowledge, techniques, and technology in dental and esthetic care.*

***Integrity***

*Our dedication to Integrity ensures that we operate with honesty, transparency, and ethical practices, fostering trust and confidence in our services.*

Le Dental Spa transcends being just a typical dental practice; it becomes a vibrant and revitalizing oasis where our vital values converge, illuminating a path towards dental and esthetic excellence, redefining the standard of care in the industry.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with founder and leadership to support the financial health of the practice.
* Provide strategic insight into cash flow, profitability, and financial performance.
* Review financial data and summarize key trends and recommendations.
* Support oversight of accounts receivable and payment processes.
* Help establish and maintain clear financial processes and controls.
* Collaborate with operations and admin to align finances with daily workflows.
* Review expenses and vendors to identify efficiency opportunities.
* Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
* Maintain professionalism, discretion, and financial integrity.
* Stay current on best practices relevant to healthcare and service-based businesses.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in a finance or financial leadership role (CFO, Fractional CFO, Controller, or similar).
* Strong understanding of cash flow, profitability, and financial planning.
* Strategic, relationship-driven approach to financial leadership.
* Clear communication skills with the ability to explain financial concepts simply.
* Strong attention to detail with a big-picture mindset.
* Ability to work independently while collaborating closely with leadership.
* Organized, proactive, and comfortable managing priorities across the business.
* Familiarity with service-based or healthcare businesses preferred

If you are a finance professional who values clarity, integrity, collaboration, and long-term growth and you’re passionate about helping a patient-first practice operate sustainably and confidently, we would love to hear from you.

Please submit your resume and a brief note introducing yourself and your relevant experience. We’re excited to connect.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $3,000.00 per month

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: VP, IT Contract & Vendor Management
jobs.description:
**Position Overview**

The Vice President (VP) of IT Contract and Vendor Management will lead the management of technology contracts and vendors across the IT organization. This position will provide both strategic oversight and tactical leadership to optimize IT spend across all categories, in alignment with competitive market benchmarks. This role will collaborate across IT, Procurement and Legal leadership to rationalize the vendor portfolio and align contract terms and rates in support of IT strategic priorities and financial plans. This position will also define and oversee governance, standards, and reporting for vendor performance to ensure that IT vendors deliver expected value and service levels, align with business objectives and company values, and comply with contractual, financial, and regulatory requirements. The role requires a strong blend of retail industry expertise, contracting acumen, procurement and vendor management experience, governance and risk management, and process execution to ensure vendor partners and investments align with IT strategic priorities and financial plans.

**A Day In The Life**

**IT Contract & Vendor Management**

* Drive Value-Based Contracting & Cost Optimization: Optimize vendor spend through TCO-driven financial models, strategic sourcing, and contract consolidation to maximize ROI.
* Manage the full lifecycle of IT contracts, from negotiation to execution and renewal across the full IT Vendor portfolio. Ensure accuracy, compliance, and timeliness of contract deliverables.
* Standardize contracting processes and optimize workflows for efficiency.
* Maintain a roadmap of near- and long-term contract lifecycle events and dependencies and partner with IT Finance and IT PMO on IT resource planning to support contract management activities.
* Partner with Procurement to ensure contracts align with IT strategy, roadmap, and budget and meet financial, operational, and legal standards while optimizing cost savings.
* Identify risks in vendor agreements and partner with IT Leadership and Procurement to mitigate exposure.
* Establish governance and processes to track and report on vendor performance, compliance, and risk management.
* Develop financial models to evaluate contract performance and monitor KPIs.

**IT Contract & Supplier Portfolio Strategy** :

* Lead IT Vendor Portfolio Strategy: Define and execute a multi-year IT vendor and contract strategy aligned to business objectives, IT roadmap, and financial plans.
* Maintain oversight of IT contracts, ensuring rigorous management of contract lifecycle events, in support of IT strategy, budgeting, and long-term planning.
* Conduct annual assessment of IT vendor portfolio; recommend strategies to support company objectives; meet IT financial plans; mitigate enterprise risk.
* Assess contract scope, spend, terms and conditions for strategic IT vendors. Identify opportunities for consolidation, renegotiation, or strategic sourcing.
* Develop and direct financial spend analysis and vendor performance analysis to deliver insights and recommendations supporting IT planning.
* Oversee roadmap of contracting activities across the IT portfolio, coordinating with Procurement, IT Finance, and IT Leadership.
* Implement performance metrics and executive-level governance to drive accountability, continuous improvement, and strategic vendor relationships.

**Leadership**

* Establish governance and controls to execute best practice vendor and contract management across IT.
* Establish reporting to track and plan for contract lifecycle events across IT.
* Establish reporting to track vendor KPIs across IT.
* Develop processes, tools, and resources to drive continuous improvement across IT Contract and Vendor management processes.
* Partner with IT executives to align vendor strategies to IT priorities and company goals.
* Mentor and develop IT Contract and Vendor Management team members, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and professional growth.

**You'll Come With**

**Education and Qualifications:** (List all required knowledge, skills and abilities for this position)

Bachelor’s degree; MBA preferred.

**Licenses/Certification/Registration:**

Certified Purchasing Manager/Certified Professional in Supply Management a plus

**Experience:**

* 10+ years of IT Strategic sourcing, Procurement, Contract Negotiation and Vendor Management experience; Procurement consulting experience at the Principal/Partner level is preferred.
* 3+ years experience managing large-scale IT contracts for a Fortune 500 company; Retail experience preferred.
* Established network of IT procurement professionals; experienced with IT benchmarking tools and services.

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Highly accountable and results-driven with a focus on operational excellence and a high level of attention to detail.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex contractual terms and conditions and report findings to executive stakeholders.
* Flexible and adaptable to the fast-paced, highly responsive, customer-centric nature of retail.
* Well-versed in relevant legislative and regulatory requirements, as well as standard contractual terms and conditions to mitigate legal risk. Knowledgeable in enterprise risk management and business continuity planning
* Able to manage multiple projects, effectively leveraging multi-disciplinary resources.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence indirectly and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.
* Proficiency in Microsoft applications: MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); reporting and analytics; modern procurement and contract management systems

**Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!**

You will enjoy competitive wages, flexible hours, and an associate discount. Burlington’s benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage including life and disability insurance. Full-time associates are also eligible for paid time off, paid holidays and a 401(k) plan. We are a rapidly growing brand and provide a variety of training and development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. Our teams work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.

Individual pay decisions will be based on a variety of factors, such as but not limited to, qualifications, education, job-related skills, relevant experience, and geographic location.

**Posting Number** R102067

**Location** New Jersey-Edgewater Park

**Address** 4287 Route 130 S

**Zip Code** 08010

**Pay Rate** Salaried

**Career Site Category** Corporate

**Position Category** Information Technology

**Job Type** Full-Time

**Remote Type** Hybrid

**Evergreen** No

jobs.title: Fractional CTO - Cloud & AI Operations (AWS/GPU, Computer Vision)
jobs.description:
**This is not a software feature-development role. We’re hiring a relationship-forward, externally-facing technical leader who can represent BrandPulse in partner/customer conversations and personally own our AWS/GPU cloud operations for a computer-vision product.**

**You won’t be the primary model builder, we already have an AI Engineer. Your job is to lead the technical function, guide the team, and ensure our cloud/GPU environment is reliable, secure, and cost-controlled.**

**Location:** Remote (US time zones preferred)  
**Type:** Paid fractional/part-time (hourly or retainer) → targeted full-time in Q2/Q3  
brandpulsemedia.ai

**Overview**  
BrandPulse builds AI + computer vision technology for sports visibility and sponsorship analytics. We’re hiring a **Fractional CTO** to own our **AWS infrastructure, GPU compute operations**—and to help guide the team as we scale.

**Non-negotiable:** You’ve owned **production AWS operations** (deployments, monitoring/alerting, incident response, cost controls) and have **hands-on AWS GPU experience**.

**Why this role**

This is a front-seat opportunity for a senior technical leader who wants CTO-level ownership—starting fractional while we ship key milestones, with a targeted ramp to full-time as we grow.

What you’ll own

1) Cloud & AI operations on AWS (core)

* Create and manage AWS environments (dev/stage/prod), set up guardrails, and keep the platform stable
* Own deployments, CI/CD, monitoring/logging, alerting, backups, and incident response
* Establish cost controls (budgets, alerts, optimization) and manage GPU spend proactively
* Own AWS security & connectivity: IAM roles/policies, secrets management, VPC/security groups, audit trail, least-privilege access

2) AWS GPU operations (core)

* Own GPU compute strategy on AWS: instance/service selection, provisioning, scaling approach, utilization, and reliability
* Support production inference/training operations with runbooks, observability, and rollback plans
* Optimize GPU cost/performance and ensure workloads “work in production”

3) Technical leadership + external communication (core)

* Lead technical demos and architecture reviews with external stakeholders (partners/customers)
* Explain roadmap, tradeoffs, and system design clearly to non-technical audiences
* Lead a small senior team (Full-Stack Engineer + AI Engineer) and set lightweight standards (code review, documentation, release process)

4) Computer vision context (leadership, not primary development)

* Understand CV/ML concepts well enough to guide the AI Engineer, make pragmatic decisions, and ensure production readiness
* Align model work with infrastructure realities (latency, reliability, cost, monitoring)

Must-have experience

* Deep AWS + DevOps ownership in production (not just “familiar with AWS”).
* Proven experience managing cloud cost and reliability tradeoffs.
* AWS security/networking fundamentals (IAM/VPC/secrets).
* Operating GPU workloads on AWS (inference and/or training).
* Ability to lead and execute in an early-stage environment.

Nice to have

* MLOps experience (model versioning, deploy/rollback, monitoring).
* IaC (Terraform/CDK/CloudFormation), containers/orchestration.
* Prior startup leadership (0→1 or early scale).

Compensation

* **Fractional/part-time to start** (scope + weekly hours agreed upfront).
* **Targeted to full-time in Q2/Q3**.
* **Equity included**.

Pay: From $100,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Hands-On HR & Recruiting Operator (1099 Contractor, On-Site) construction and manufacturing
jobs.description:
Description:

**Job Type**
------------

Independent Contractor (1099)  
Part-time consulting engagement  
**On-site 3 days per week (required)**  
Location: **Manassas, VA**

**Compensation**
----------------

**1099** Initial **90-day engagement**  
Extension or conversion to W-2 may be considered based on performance  
No guaranteed duration beyond initial term

**About the Role**
------------------

We are a commercial glazing contractor and glass fabrication company looking for a **hands-on HR and recruiting operator** to take day-to-day hiring and employee issues off leadership’s plate.

This is **not a strategic HR role** and **not an advisory consulting role**.

You will be on-site three days per week and expected to **personally execute the work** — recruiting, interviewing, onboarding, employee relations, and documentation.

If you prefer advising leadership, designing programs, or working remotely, this role is **not a fit**.

**Scope of Work (Execution Required)**
--------------------------------------

### **Recruiting & Hiring (Primary Focus)**

* Personally manage full-cycle recruiting for hourly and salaried roles
* Post jobs, screen resumes, and conduct first-round interviews
* Coordinate second-round interviews with leadership
* Maintain hiring momentum without constant oversight
* Support offers and onboarding using Paylocity
* Recruit for:  
  + Field installers and helpers
  + Production / plant staff
  + Office and coordinator roles
  + project Managers
  + supervisors
  + Estimators

### **Employee Relations (Hands-On)**

* Be a visible, on-site HR presence
* Address attendance, performance, and conduct issues early
* Meet directly with employees when issues arise
* Draft corrective actions and documentation
* Support terminations when required
* Prevent issues from escalating to ownership unnecessarily

### **HR Operations Support**

* Maintain employee records and documentation
* Support onboarding and off boarding processes
* Build, Maintain, and update job descriptions
* Coordinate benefits and payroll support as needed
* Use Paylocity HR Edge for compliance guidance

**What This Role Is NOT**
-------------------------

* Not remote or hybrid
* Not a strategic HR leadership position
* Not a policy-only or advisory role
* Not a VP, Director, or “Head of People” role

This role is about **doing the work**, not directing others to do it.

Requirements:

**Qualifications**
------------------

* 5+ years of **hands-on HR and recruiting experience**
* Significant experience with **hourly employees**
* Prior experience in **construction, manufacturing, trades, or industrial environments** strongly preferred
* Comfortable handling difficult employee conversations directly
* Confident interviewer who can move hiring forward independently
* Experience with HRIS systems (Paylocity preferred)
* Comfortable working without a large HR team

**Work Expectations**
---------------------

* **On-site three fixed days per week**
* Professional, job-site-appropriate business attire required
* Independent contractor invoices monthly
* Engagement may be ended at any time if expectations are not met

**How Success Is Measured**
---------------------------

* Hiring moves forward without leadership involvement
* Employee issues are addressed early and documented
* Fewer interruptions to ownership
* Work is completed without constant direction

jobs.title: Office Manager (Part-Time)
jobs.description:
### **Part-Time Office Manager (In-Person)**

**Location:** Brooklyn, NY **Employment Type:** Part-time (20 hours/week)

**Compensation:** $36K - $50K

We are a leading financial technology firm specializing in risk management, oracles, and AI models that secure billions in value across the digital asset ecosystem. Our mission is to build technology that makes markets safer and more accessible by providing world-class financial tools to the world's most innovative protocols.

We are looking for a talented **Part-Time Office Manager** to join our team on-site in Brooklyn! Reporting directly to the VP of Business Operations, you will be the heartbeat of our physical workspace, ensuring our daily operations run seamlessly and our team has an environment where they can do their best work.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **Daily Operations:** Act as the primary on-site support for daily needs, including hospitality, coffee service, and general logistics.
* **Inventory & Facilities:** Manage monthly stocking plans for office supplies and our micro-kitchen (snacks/drinks). Conduct daily walkthroughs to ensure the office is clean, organized, and welcoming.
* **Meeting Coordination:** Prepare and reserve meeting rooms, ensuring A/V readiness, cleanliness, and professional presentation for all sessions.
* **Vendor Liaison:** Coordinate with building management (WeWork/building services) and external vendors for maintenance, deliveries, and cleaning services.
* **Executive Support:** Assist the CEO with administrative tasks, including meeting preparation, light travel logistics, and ad hoc requests.
* **Culture Building:** Plan and execute in-office events and team gatherings, managing everything from vendor selection to on-site setup and support.

**Requirements**

* **Experience:** 2+ years of experience in office management, administrative support, hospitality, or workplace operations.
* **Availability:** Ability to work on-site in Brooklyn **Monday–Friday, 4 hours per day** (Standard schedule: 8:30 AM – 1:00 PM).
* **Soft Skills:** Strong organizational skills, high attention to detail, and a proactive, service-oriented mindset.
* **Adaptability:** Comfortable handling multiple priorities independently in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
* **Interests:** Strong problem-solving abilities and a genuine interest in DeFi and blockchain technology.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous experience supporting senior executives (CEO/Leadership).
* Proficiency with modern workplace tools (Google Workspace, Slack, Notion).

**Benefits**

* **Professional Growth:** Opportunity to work at the forefront of the fintech and blockchain industry alongside a world-class team.
* **Impact:** Play a pivotal role in shaping our office culture and daily employee experience.
* **Dynamic Environment:** Work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative atmosphere.

We genuinely appreciate your interest and wish you the best in your job search.**

Our goal is to foster a diverse, inclusive workplace with equal opportunities for all. If you need any reasonable adjustments during any part of the hiring process or you would like to see the job-advert in an accessible format please let us know at the earliest opportunity by emailing human-resources@mlabs.city.

MLabs Ltd collects and processes the personal information you provide such as your contact details, work history, resume, and other relevant data for recruitment purposes only. This information is managed securely in accordance with MLabs Ltd’s Privacy Policy and Information Security Policy, and in compliance with applicable data protection laws. Your data may be shared only with clients and trusted partners where necessary for recruitment purposes. You may request the deletion of your data or withdraw your consent at any time by contacting legal@mlabs.city.

jobs.title: Part-time CAD Designer (Remote role - 25 hours week)
jobs.description:
**Company Overview**

Allbridge is the leading supplier of world class connected technology solutions, services, and support for high-density properties.

With more than 35 years of continuous growth and industry experience, Allbridge supports technology in over one million rooms, in 8,000 properties, across North America and the Caribbean, including hotels, resorts, senior-living communities, condominiums, multifamily developments, and mixed-use properties.

**Job Summary**

The CAD Designer is responsible for creating technology plans for hotels and multi-dwelling units, which show low voltage cabling, and the various technology systems offered by Allbridge overlayed over existing architectural, interior design or electrical plans. The designer will primarily use AutoCAD, Bluebeam and occasionally REVIT to generate these plans as well as the building equipment schedules for the property’s technology systems. This role reports to the Vice President of Property Technology Solutions.

**Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities**

  

* Part-time temporary role expected to be 25 hours per week for a duration of 3-5 months
* Assist Lead design team on LowVoltage Technology Plans in AutoCAD 2020
* Utilize AutoCAD and backgrounds provided by architects and interior designers to locate low voltage cabling (CAT6A, RG6Q,Fiber) and technology systems i.e., operations and applications, network, guest experience, audio visual experience and building automation
* Track a project’s lifecycle using SmartSheet
* Participate in owner, architect and consultant planning meetings
* Participate and contribute during OAC meetings via web
* Provide feedback to architects and interior designs on technology requirements
* Respond to requests for information (RFIs)
* Prepare specification books in Word
* Assist Lead design team in creating change logs and change narratives for plans
* Consistently integrates Allbridge’s core values into their everyday habits by treating all customers, internal and external, professionally, honestly and respectfully
* Accepts ownership and accountability of position responsibilities and strives to deliver results for customers that establish high standards, credibility and quality performance

**Required/Desired Qualifications**

  

* 5 years of experience using CAD software
* Must have experience working in Procore, ACC, and other building planning software.
* Prefer Associate’s degree
* Must possess intermediate to expert level experience in AutoCAD 2020
* Must possess basic to intermediate experience in Revit
* Strong organizational skills
* Excellent attention to detail
* An abundance of patience to see a complicated project to the end
* Ability to think in a three-dimensional manner
* Comfortable with sitting for long periods of time
* Ability to work as part of a team with strong collaboration skills

**Workplace Benefits We Offer**

In addition to earnings and other incentives, Allbridge offers a comprehensive package of benefits, based on eligibility, typically for regular, full-time positions, some of which includes:

  

* Medical and Prescription options, Dental, Orthodontics and Vision Plans
* Rich HSA company-funded options and Flexible Spending accounts
* 100% Company paid premiums for Short Term Disability
* Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment insurance Plan options
* Supplemental Insurance Plan options
* 401(k) Profit-Sharing Retirement plan
* Flexible Paid Time Off after60 daysof employment
* Paid Holidays, per Employee Handbook
* Work culture supportive of diversity and inclusion

**Equal Opportunity Employer Statement**

Allbridge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Allbridge does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

jobs.title: Part Time Cash Office Associate
jobs.description:
As a member of the C&S Wholesale Grocers family of companies, SpartanNash is a food solutions company that delivers the ingredients for a better life. A distributor, wholesaler and retailer with a global supply chain network, SpartanNash distributes grocery and household goods, including fresh produce and the Our Family® portfolio of products, to locations in all 50 states.

Our braggingly happy team members — ranging from bakery managers to order selectors; from IT developers to vice presidents of finance; from HR Business Partners to export specialists — create braggingly happy customers spanning national accounts, independent and chain grocers, e-commerce retailers, U.S. military commissaries and exchanges, and the Company’s own brick-and-mortar grocery stores, pharmacies and fuel centers.

Ready to contribute to the success of our food solutions company? Apply now!

**Location:**

835 S. Washington Street - Bismarck, North Dakota 58504

**Position Summary:**

This role is responsible for completing the cash office operations in an accurate and efficient manner. Responsible to verify/review lane tracking, daily refunds, paid-outs, various deposits, and perform other duties as assigned to ensure that the work shift contributes positively to the best interests of the store. Complete all other duties as assigned in a timely manner.

**Here’s what you’ll do:**

* Observe strict confidentiality of all company records and financial information to safeguard against unauthorized access to such information at all times
* Perform and monitor front end activities to ensure that all cashiers comply with store policies in the handling of all transactions: cash, checks, debit/credit cards, food stamps, ID requirements, over rings, refunds, bottle returns, vendor coupons, gift cards, vouchers, lottery ticket sales, and postage.
* Follow all policies pertaining to the sale of alcoholic beverages, tobacco, pseudoephedrine, etc.
* Able to operate cash register, display cost of customer purchase, make change, cash checks, and issue receipts.
* Knowledgeable of product locations in the store, in order to be able to assist customers
* Knowledgeable and capable of implementing all related security and cash drawer accounting procedures.
* Keep management informed of problems with pricing, cash registers, scales, or other cash office problems.
* Maintain records on cash controls for internal audits.
* Greet all customers and provide them with prompt and courteous service or assistance.
* Maintain a clean, attractive, and customer-friendly store. .
* Follow all PPE and Safety Guidelines
* Follow all Food Safety and Cleaning Expectations
* Follow Guest Experience Guidelines
* May be assigned tasks in other departments based on customer experience need
* Additional responsibilities may be assigned as needed

**Here’s what you’ll need:**

* High school diploma (GED ) preferred
* One year of retail or related experience preferred.
* Ability to read, write, comprehend, and interpret documents
* Basic mathematical skills
* Detail Oriented
* Organizational skills
* Basic computer knowledge (email, spreadsheets, etc.)

**Physical Requirements**:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be required to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds frequently, and up to 50 pounds occasionally. The associate is required to stand and walk for extended periods of time and may bend, stoop, twist and turn frequently. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is subject to a typical retail store environment (varied temperatures) and is exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate. Travel requirements vary by assignment.

As part of our **People First** culture, SpartanNash is proud to offer a robust and competitive Total Rewards benefits package.

SpartanNash is an Equal Opportunity Employer that invests in Associate development, recognizes and celebrates success, fosters two-way communication, and promotes a sense of belonging. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, including those with disabilities and Veterans.

We are not able to sponsor work visas for this position.

* May be assigned tasks in other departments based on customer experience need
* Additional responsibilities may be assigned as needed

**Here’s What You’ll Need:**

* High school diploma (GED) preferred
* One year of retail or related experience preferred.

* Ability to read, write, comprehend, and interpret documents
* Basic mathematical skills
* Detail Oriented

**Physical Requirements:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be required to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds frequently, and up to 50 pounds occasionally. The associate is required to stand and walk for extended periods of time and may bend, stoop, twist and turn frequently. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is subject to a typical retail store environment (varied temperatures) and is exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate. Travel requirements vary by assignment.

As part of our **People First** culture, SpartanNash is proud to offer a robust and competitive Total Rewards benefits package.

SpartanNash is an Equal Opportunity Employer that invests in Associate development, recognizes and celebrates success, fosters two-way communication, and promotes a sense of belonging. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, including those with disabilities and Veterans.

We are not able to sponsor work visas for this position.
jobs.description_snippet:
As a member of the C&S Wholesale Grocers family of companies, SpartanNash is a food solutions company that delivers the ingredients for a better life. A distributor, wholesaler and retailer with a global supply chain network, SpartanNash distributes grocery and household goods, including fresh produce and the Our Family® portfolio of products, to locations in all 50 states.

Our braggingly happy team members — ranging from bakery managers to order selectors; from IT developers to vice presidents

jobs.title: Contracts and Compliance Manager (Part-Time)
jobs.description:
The (Part-Time) Contracts and Compliance Manager will direct all contracts, outcomes and compliance activities throughout the organization for all entities to ensure positive outcomes/deliverables are on a timely basis.

You will act as a lead on all major program/project start-ups and interim reporting, assist with research and strategic planning, public policy, and network integration.

You will ensure proper dashboard reporting to the Executive Team and Program staff on a regular and consistent basis.

This part-time, exempt, office-based role will report to the Sr, VP, Sales & Marketing and will be located in Salem, NH.

#### **Responsibilities:**

* Review all government Requests for Information (RFI), Request for Proposal (RFP), grant applications, and Purchase Order (PO) Terms & Conditions (Ts & Cs) for contractual obligations. Advise Executive Team of their impact to GPD and assess GPD’s compliance with all obligations prior to award or contract execution.
* Oversee program and corporate preparation and submission of all grants and/or contracts at start up; Distribute and maintain records of routing sheets for all grants, contracts, and agreements.
* Keep an updated control log with new contracts; remove expired contracts/ reports. Prepare individual spreadsheets from master spreadsheet for each staff member who has reports or contract deliverables due in the upcoming month. Promptly notify staff members of their monthly deliverable responsibilities.
* Ensure timely submission of all reporting requirements, including various customer and government supplier cyber performance risk reporting systems. Responsible for collecting all grants, reports and audits from various departments and maintain corporate system for routing and management of formal documentation.
* Lead delegation & compliance requirements for all subcontracts and subdivisional program expectations and build accountability matrix with appropriate measurements.
* Manage System for Award Management, government website which needs to be updated periodically for RCAP Solutions, Financial Services and 9 properties. This ensures active subsidy moneys are sent.
* Supply Chain Risk Management: Oversee and monitor compliance with GPD subcontractors.
* Regular updates on program audits vs. corporate compliance efforts, reports to funders & corrective action activities to CSuite.
* Identify and assist where deficiencies are located and in cooperation with the compliance team create a structured “Care Plan” to remedy and meet contract expectations;
* Assist the budget manager and program managers respectively to finalize all outcomes against proposed efforts, budgets, cash management/billings and staffing/other resources;
* Host all set up meetings directly and create timely progress charts for expectations of all departments where needed.
* Ongoing partnership with Fiscal & Program Departments respectively to ensure all contract terms and deliverables are met and secondary compliance issues are addressed.
* Coordination of vital data output for all networks, grants, contracts and compliance efforts in concert with others.

#### **Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required; 3 5 years legal, business or contract administration, Master’s Degree preferred; this is an interdisciplinary role that requires a combination of business acumen, financial, technology and interpersonal talents.
* Verbal and written communications possess the ability to compose and edit business documents; contract interpretation, write and articulate verbally in a clear, concise and effective manner; strong editorial capacity for spelling and grammar, and effectively communicate thoughts, and ideas in a written format.
* Development (or other) relevant research skills required; excellent computer, networking, and organizational skills; ability to manage multiple tasks; creative, resultsoriented personality; team player; detail oriented.
* Comprehensive reporting/proposal development skills including work plans, schedules and budgets; ability to manage multiple proposal development projects simultaneously, including constructing and monitoring detailed schedules.
* Experience/knowledge of Dept of War (DOW, formerly DoD) cybersecurity requirements including but not limited to DFARS 252.2047012 “Safeguarding Covered Defense Information and Cyber Incident Reporting”, CMMC, and related FAR and DFARS clauses.
* Experience/knowledge of ITAR and EAR compliance.
* Experience in setting priorities and meeting deadlines while balancing the needs of providing support for multiple individuals, of directors, committees, task forces, and special projects.
* Represents the organization to the national development efforts and others as needed.
* Entrepreneurial capacity to think “out of the box” and assist the President & CEO in new ventures.

#### **MISC:**

* Able to lift up to 25lbs

GPD provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#### **About GPD**

At GPD Optoelectronics, we believe that by operating with integrity and trust we drive constant organizational improvement, which strengthens our relationships with our employees and customers. Customer success remains our highest priority, so we strive to deliver high-quality products on time, and provide unparalleled service, responsiveness, and collaboration.

Founded in 1973 as Germanium Power Devices Corp, we began by making high-quality germanium transistors. Since the early 1980’s we have earned our place as a trusted manufacturer of both germanium and indium gallium arsenide photodiodes. We are located in Salem, NH.

#### **About GPD Optoelectronics**

GPD Optoelectronics is expanding! Do you have an unwavering commitment to continuous improvement? Do you share the passionate belief that we must always strive to do better? Based out of Salem, NH, our team members are design-oriented, customer-focused, and work hard to engineer custom solutions for every client’s needs. If you have an eye for detail and share our passion for the photonics industry, come join our team of professionals who are dedicated to advancing tomorrow’s photo detector technology!
