jobs.title: Director IT, Agent Contracting Platform
jobs.description:
Our Company

Explore how you can contribute at AmeriLife.

For over 50 years, AmeriLife has been a leader in the development, marketing and distribution of annuity, life and health insurance solutions for those planning for and living in retirement.

Associates get satisfaction from knowing they provide agents, marketers and carrier partners the support needed to succeed in a rapidly evolving industry.

Job Summary

AmeriLife is seeking a strategic and hands on Director, IT – Agent Contracting Platform to own the enterprise delivery, governance, and operational success of AmeriLife’s agent contracting and onboarding ecosystem. This platform is currently delivered as a SaaS solution (AgentSync), with all configurations, development, and operational support primarily managed by the vendor.  
  
This role will initially function as a senior individual contributor, serving as the enterprise product and technology owner for the platform. While there may be limited direct people management at the outset, the role requires strong leadership capability, deep technical understanding, and readiness to build and lead a team as the platform footprint expands.  
  
The Director will be accountable for platform strategy, vendor execution oversight, integrations, production stability, roadmap alignment, and stakeholder satisfaction across Contracting, Licensing, Compliance, Operations, Sales, and IT.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Platform Ownership & Strategy

* Serve as the enterprise owner for the Agent Contracting Platform, defining vision, roadmap, and success metrics.
* Align platform capabilities with AmeriLife’s distribution growth, compliance requirements, and business strategy.
* Own prioritization of enhancements, configuration changes, and integrations in partnership with business stakeholders.

Vendor‑Led Development & Delivery Oversight

* Oversee all vendor‑managed development, configuration, and release execution.
* Act as the technical and functional authority validating solution designs, delivery plans, and release outcomes.
* Ensure vendor delivery aligns with enterprise architecture, security standards, and data governance expectations.

Technical Leadership & Integrations

* Own end‑to‑end platform architecture from an enterprise perspective, including integrations with CRM, licensing, data platforms, identity management, and downstream systems.
* Partner with Data Engineering and Enterprise Architecture teams on integration design, data quality, monitoring, and scalability.
* Provide hands‑on technical leadership despite the SaaS delivery model, ensuring informed decision‑making and vendor accountability.

Production Support & Operational Governance

* Own production stability, platform availability, incident management, and escalation coordination with the vendor.
* Define and enforce SLAs, KPIs, monitoring, and support processes.
* Lead root‑cause analysis, post‑incident reviews, and continuous improvement initiatives.

Vendor & Relationship Management

* Serve as the primary relationship owner for AgentSync and any related third‑party vendors.
* Manage contracts, SOWs, renewals, roadmap alignment, and performance reviews.
* Hold vendors accountable for quality, responsiveness, transparency, and value realization.

Leadership & Future Team Growth

* Initially operate as a senior individual contributor with enterprise‑wide ownership and accountability.
* Establish operating models, governance processes, and documentation that enable future team scaling.
* Prepare to build, mentor, and lead a dedicated team as the platform and organizational needs grow.
* Communicate clearly and effectively with senior leaders, providing transparency into risks, delivery status, and opportunities.

Required Qualifications

* 10+ years of progressive IT experience with a strong background in application development or enterprise platforms.
* 5+ years of leadership or platform ownership experience involving vendor‑led delivery models.
* Proven ability to operate effectively as a hands‑on leader and individual contributor at a Director level.
* Strong experience with:
  + SaaS enterprise platforms
  + API‑based integrations and data orchestration
  + SDLC, Agile delivery, and release management
  + Production support and incident management
* Demonstrated success managing strategic vendors and complex stakeholder relationships.
* Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and decision‑making skills.

Preferred Skills

* Direct experience with AgentSync (Manage, AutoPilot, Producer Sync, Appointments).
* Familiarity with agent licensing, contracting, onboarding, or compliance platforms.
* Insurance, financial services, or distribution‑based business experience.
* Ability to operate across business, technical, and compliance domains.
* Comfort influencing without authority in matrixed organizations.

Why Join AmeriLife?

AmeriLife continues to modernize and scale its agent technology ecosystem. As Director, IT – Agent Contracting Platform, you will own a mission‑critical platform supporting agent onboarding, compliance, and growth—playing a central role in ensuring AmeriLife can scale efficiently, compliantly, and reliably across all distribution channels.

What AmeriLife Offers

A comprehensive benefits package that includes PTO, medical, dental, vision, retirement savings, disability insurance, and life insurance.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value diversity at all levels of the organization. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable federal, state, or local law. We are committed to providing an inclusive, equitable, and respectful workplace where all employees can thrive.

Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Statement

We are committed to full compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and all applicable state and local disability laws. Reasonable accommodations are available to qualified applicants and employees with disabilities throughout the application and employment process. Requests for accommodation will be handled confidentially. If you require assistance or accommodation during the application process, please contact us at

HR@AmeriLife.com

.

Pay Transparency Statement

We are committed to pay transparency and equity, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Compensation for this role will be determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and market factors. Where required by law, the pay range for this position will be disclosed in the job posting or provided upon request. Additional compensation information, such as benefits, bonuses, and commissions, will be provided as required by law. We do not discriminate or retaliate against employees or applicants for inquiring about, discussing, or disclosing their pay or the pay of another employee or applicant, as protected under applicable law. Pay ranges are available upon request.

Background Screening Statement

Employment offers are contingent upon the successful completion of a background screening, which may include employment verification, education verification, criminal history check, and other job-related inquiries, as permitted by law. All screenings are conducted in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws, and information collected will be kept confidential. If any adverse decision is made based on the results, applicants will be notified and given an opportunity to respond.

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) [USA]
jobs.description:
This is a remote position.

**Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)**
--------------------------------------------

  

Company: Vulcury LLC

Location: US

Engagement: Fractional / Part-time (scope-based; potential to expand)

Reporting Line: CEO (based in California, United States)

Compensation: Competitive, commensurate with experience and scope

  

### **About Vulcury**

Vulcury LLC is a venture studio and growth advisory firm that builds, incubates, and scales businesses across a diverse set of industries, while also supporting select external growth engagements. The firm operates a centralised growth function that spans:

  

* Internally incubated companies at varying stages of maturity
  
* Client engagements across multiple sectors
  
* Research- and content-driven initiatives related to financial markets and investment themes
  

While a meaningful portion of Vulcury’s current work supports manufacturers and industrial businesses through its subsidiary TrustBridge, the broader growth mandate includes technology-enabled services, professional services, and investment-related research and publishing efforts.

  
  

### **Role Overview**

Vulcury is seeking a Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) based in Sydney to provide senior marketing leadership across its multi-industry portfolio of businesses and engagements.

This role is well-suited for an experienced marketing executive who is comfortable operating across different verticals, business models, and audience types—including B2B services, industrial and manufacturing ecosystems, and financial or investment-oriented content and platforms.

The Fractional CMO will work closely with a CEO based in California, collaborate with senior leaders across Vulcury’s subsidiaries, and oversee a primarily India-based execution team responsible for day-to-day growth activities across channels.

This is a hands-on leadership role, requiring active involvement in strategy, prioritisation, review, and refinement—not merely high-level advisory input.

  
  

### **Key Responsibilities**

#### **Marketing Strategy & Leadership**

  

* Define and refine marketing strategies across multiple businesses, industries, and engagement types.
  
* Establish clear growth priorities, sequencing, and success metrics across initiatives.
  
* Balance near-term demand generation with longer-term brand and authority building.
  

#### **Channel Oversight & Execution**

Provide senior-level oversight and guidance across a broad mix of channels, including:

  

* Paid social and digital advertising
  
* SEO and website optimization
  
* Content marketing and thought leadership (blogs, long-form articles, research-driven content)
  
* Email campaigns, lifecycle marketing, and SDR-support workflows
  
* Webinars, podcasts, and virtual events
  
* Media creation and multi-platform distribution
  

These efforts may support:

  

* Operating businesses within the Vulcury portfolio
  
* External client growth engagements
  
* Investment research, commentary, and financial thought leadership initiatives
  

#### **Team Leadership (India-Based)**

  

* Lead and mentor a distributed marketing and growth team based primarily in India.
  
* Translate strategic objectives into clear, executable work streams.
  
* Ensure quality, consistency, and performance across channels and verticals.
  

#### **Cross-Functional & Cross-Regional Collaboration**

  

* Interface directly with the U.S.-based CEO and senior leadership on priorities and performance.
  
* Coordinate with product, sales, research, and operations leaders to ensure alignment.
  
* Adapt messaging and channel strategy to different buyer types, sales cycles, and audiences.
  

#### **Industry-Specific Context (As Relevant)**

  

* Support initiatives related to manufacturing, supply chain, and industrial services where applicable.
  
* Contribute to growth and content strategies related to financial investments, markets, and research-driven products.
  
* Adjust marketing approaches to suit technical, regulated, or high-trust environments.
  

  

### **Engagement Details**

  

* Structure: Fractional / part-time, scope-based
  
* Location: Sydney, Australia (remote-friendly with cross-time-zone collaboration)
  
* Travel: Occasional travel may be beneficial but is not required
  

  
  
  
  
  
  

### **Benefits**

### **Why This Role**

  

* Fractional flexibility: Senior-level influence without full-time constraint.
  
* Industry breadth: Exposure to multiple sectors, audiences, and growth challenges.
  
* Global collaboration: Work at the intersection of U.S.-based leadership and India-based execution.
  
* Substantive impact: Direct ownership of strategy, prioritisation, and execution quality.
  
* Expandable scope: Opportunity to deepen or broaden engagement as Vulcury scales.

jobs.title: VP, Advisory and Contract Execution - Prime Brokerage and ISDA Negotiation
jobs.description:
**Work Location** :

New York, New York, United States of America

**Hours:**

40

**Line of Business:**

TD Securities

**Pay Detail:**

$225,000 - $225,000 USD

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.

As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.

**Job Description:**

The Advisory and Contract Execution Team is an integral part of TD Securities. The group provides best-of-class service to business partners in TD Bank Financial Group (the Bank) through negotiation and execution of agreements that govern capital markets trading products. The team is committed to providing a seamless client experience while managing the Bank’s risk.

The position will be responsible for providing best-of-class service to clients of TD Securities and internal business partners by preparing and negotiating legal documentation with global counterparties for trading products such as cash prime brokerage and equity derivatives, (i.e. Prime Brokerage Agreements, Term Commitment Agreements, ISDA Master Agreements, Credit Support Annexes, Master Confirmation Agreements, Regulatory IM Documents, Account Control Agreements, Custody Agreements). The position must ensure that the Bank is sufficiently protected from legal, risk, and operational perspectives in all such trading documents and other legal documentation between the Bank and its counterparties. The position will be required to build and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders across the Bank and be available to service the deal flow with tight deadlines from global desks.

**Depth & Scope:**

* Ensures that the Bank is sufficiently protected from legal, risk, and operational perspectives in all such trading documents and other legal documentation between the Bank and its counterparties
* Required to build and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders across the Bank and be available to service the deal flow with tight deadlines from global desks
* Leads negotiations of Prime Brokerage Agreements, Term Commitment Agreements, ISDA Master Agreements, CSAs, Master Confirmation Agreements, Regulatory IM Documents, Account Control Agreements and Custody Agreements with a variety of counterparties, including hedge funds and registered funds
* Leads or participates in internal calls with senior credit officers and front office contacts, as well as calls with clients and external legal counsel, to discuss issues that arise during negotiations of trading agreements and/or prime brokerage related documents
* Liaises and coordinates with internal stakeholders, such as Credit, Business, Tax, Legal, Operations and Collateral Management, during the documentation process
* Provides timely updates to the Business on the status of negotiations, whether via weekly calls or through the team's internal document tracking system
* Supports internal initiatives related to documentation, process automation, and regulatory compliance

**Education & Experience:**

* Law degree is required
* 5+ years of solid legal, trading documentation, capital markets, origination or related experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* J.D. required, New York Bar Admission preferred
* 6-8 years of experience (either at a law firm or a dealer)
* Strong North American prime brokerage negotiation experience, together with experience negotiating term commitment agreements and custody agreements.
* Solid experience negotiating ISDA Master Agreements, Credit Support Annexes, Master Confirmation Agreements and Account Control Agreements with hedge funds and registered funds.
* Experience negotiating the full suite of regulatory initial margin documentation.
* The candidate for this position will enjoy working on legal trading documentation, be able to effectively apply legal and sound risk management principles and display good drafting ability.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, good PC skills and the ability to multi-task and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced trading environment are requirements.
* Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills are essential.
* Ability to work under tight deadlines and flexibility to support global time zones as required.

**Physical Requirements:**

Never: 0%; Occasional: 1-33%; Frequent: 34-66%; Continuous: 67-100%

* Domestic Travel – Occasional
* International Travel – Never
* Performing sedentary work – Continuous
* Performing multiple tasks – Continuous
* Operating standard office equipment - Continuous
* Responding quickly to sounds – Occasional
* Sitting – Continuous
* Standing – Occasional
* Walking – Occasional
* Moving safely in confined spaces – Occasional
* Lifting/Carrying (under 25 lbs.) – Occasional
* Lifting/Carrying (over 25 lbs.) – Never
* Squatting – Occasional
* Bending – Occasional
* Kneeling – Never
* Crawling – Never
* Climbing – Never
* Reaching overhead – Never
* Reaching forward – Occasional
* Pushing – Never
* Pulling – Never
* Twisting – Never
* Concentrating for long periods of time – Continuous
* Applying common sense to deal with problems involving standardized situations – Continuous
* Reading, writing and comprehending instructions – Continuous
* Adding, subtracting, multiplying and dividing – Continuous

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. The listed or specified responsibilities & duties are considered essential functions for ADA purposes.

**Who We Are**

TD Securities offers a wide range of capital markets products and services to corporate, government, and institutional clients who choose us for our innovation, execution, and experience. With more than 6,500 professionals operating out of 40 cities across the globe, we help clients meet their needs today and prepare for tomorrow. Our services include underwriting and distributing new issues, providing trusted advice and industry-leading insight, extending access to global markets, and delivering integrated transaction banking solutions. In 2023, we acquired Cowen Inc., offering our clients access to a premier U.S. equities business and highly-diverse equity research franchise, while growing our strong, diversified investment bank. We are growth-oriented, people-focused, and community-minded. As a team, we work to deliver value for our clients every day.

**Our Total Rewards Package**  
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. Learn more

**Additional Information:**  
We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.
  
  
**Colleague Development**  
If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.
  
  
**Training & Onboarding**  
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.
  
  
**Interview Process**  
We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.

**Accommodation**

TD Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

If you are an applicant with a disability and need accommodations to complete the application process, please email TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com . Include your full name, best way to reach you and the accommodation needed to assist you with the applicant process.

jobs.title: B2B Outreach & Partnerships Contractor (Temporary, Part-Time)
jobs.description:
**Role Overview**

Laurus College is seeking a B2B Outreach & Partnerships Contractor to expand and strengthen relationships with employers, workforce organizations, and community partners. This temporary part time role is critical to growing our adult learner enrollment pipeline through employer-sponsored education, tuition reimbursement partnerships, and workforce development collaborations.

Reporting to the EVP of Enrollment Operations, this contractor will execute targeted outbound outreach, manage early-stage partnership conversations, and build a sustainable B2B prospecting engine using LinkedIn Sales Navigator and CRM tools.

This is an execution-focused role with clear outcomes, high autonomy, and direct impact on enrollment growth. Remote, with occasional local outreach as needed.

**Key Responsibilities**

**B2B Prospecting & Outreach**

* Use *LinkedIn Sales Navigator* to identify, segment, and prioritize employer prospects aligned with Laurus programs.
* Conduct personalized outreach to HR leaders, L&D managers, talent leaders, and business owners.
* Design and execute outreach cadence (connection requests, follow-ups, email, messaging) with professionalism and persistence.
* Track outreach activity, responses, and conversion metrics in CRM or tracking tools.

**Employer Partnerships Development**

* Initiate and qualify employer conversations related to:
* Tuition reimbursement partnerships
* Upskilling/reskilling programs
* Workforce development initiatives
* Customized cohort or referral agreements
* Schedule and prepare warm handoffs or meetings with internal leadership as appropriate.
* Maintain a pipeline of active and developing employer relationships.

**Collaboration & Alignment**

* Collaborate with internal Admissions and Marketing stakeholders as needed to align outreach efforts with program offerings and messaging.
* Provide periodic summaries of outreach activity, pipeline status, and partner engagement trends.
* Share market insights and feedback to inform employer messaging and partnership strategy.

**Success Metrics**

* Number of qualified employer conversations initiated
* Meetings booked with decision-makers
* Active employer partnerships in pipeline
* Conversion of partnerships to student referrals or enrollments
* Consistent, documented outreach activity and follow-through

**Required Qualifications**

* 3+ years of experience in B2B outreach, business development, partnerships, or sales (education or workforce development experience strongly preferred)
* Proven experience using *LinkedIn Sales Navigator* for outbound prospecting
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple outreach streams simultaneously
* Comfortable working independently in a contractor environment
* Familiarity with CRM systems and outreach tracking

**Preferred Experience**

* Higher education, workforce development, or training/learning partnerships
* Selling into HR, Talent, L&D, or executive audiences
* Experience supporting adult learners or non-traditional students

**Time Commitment and Details**

* Estimated workload equivalent to 15–25 hours per week, based on scope and project needs
* Initial 6-month engagement, with potential extension of an additional 3–6 months (to be determined)
* Flexible schedule; contractor determines work hours to meet agreed-upon deliverables and deadlines
* Independent contractor, temporary engagement; no benefits provided

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Contract

Pay: $4,500.00 - $6,000.00 per month

Expected hours: 15.0 – 25.0 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chula Vista, CA 91914

jobs.title: Vice President- Advisory Partner, Insurance Applied Advisory
jobs.description:
***Ready to shape the future of work?***

***At Genpact, we don’t just adapt to change—we drive it. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s*** ***AI Gigafactory******, our industry-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large-scale models to*** ***agentic AI******, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges.***

***If you thrive in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, love solving real-world problems, and want to be part of a team that’s shaping the future, this is your moment.***

***Genpact (NYSE: G) is an******advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers******lasting******value for leading enterprises******globally.******Through our******deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead.******Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation******,******our teams******implement******data, technology, and AI******to******create tomorrow, today.******Get to know us at******genpact.com******and on******LinkedIn******,******X******,******YouTube******, and******Facebook******.***

**Inviting applications for the role of** **Vice President-****Advisory Partner, Insurance Applied Advisory**

**As the Advisory Partner for Insurance, you will be responsible for growing the $22M Industry Advisory practice and enabling strategic growth across Genpact. This role reports into the Global Advisory Leader and is considered a part of the Applied Advisory leadership team. This is a highly senior role requiring deep industry expertise specifically in the Property and Casualty domain, a forward-thinking mindset, experience across insurance sectors, and a deep understanding of advanced technology solutions.**

**Responsible for driving digital transformation across the insurance value chain. This executive will combine deep P&C domain expertise with a passion for innovation, data, and technology to help clients reimagine their businesses for the digital age.**

**As a trusted advisor to C-suite leaders, the** **Principal** **shapes strategy, leads large-scale transformation programs, and builds long-term client partnerships. This role is central to expanding our firm’s presence in the P&C market—integrating business consulting, experience design, analytics, and intelligent automation to deliver measurable impact.**

**Responsibilities**

**Strategic Leadership and Vision**

**Define and lead the global strategy for the Insurance Advisory practice, ensuring alignment with the overall Genpact strategy and that of the given Industry Unit (P&L) Leader.**

**Lead the development of property and casualty relevant service offerings which can be scaled, ensuring innovation and adaptability to client and market demands.**

**Shape long-term business strategies, focusing on market trends, emerging technologies, and client needs to ensure competitiveness and future growth.**

**Develop end-to-end value chain view for the industry that communicates how Genpact can bring value to clients.**

**Business Growth and Expansion**

**Drive business development initiatives by identifying new markets, services, and clients to grow the advisory insurance business.**

**Building and maintaining a pipeline of opportunities, tracking leads, and ensuring that potential projects are followed through to successful engagement.**

**Deliver bookings and revenue growth to target via conversion of pipeline opportunities.**

**Collaborate with regional and global leadership to expand service offerings and enter new markets.**

**Identify opportunities for expanding Genpact services to drive business value across client engagement.**

**Identify emerging market trends and client needs to shape go-to-market strategies and thought leadership in the P&C space.**

**Client Engagement and Relationship Management**

**Build and nurture trusted advisory relationships with C-suite executives and senior leaders in key client organizations.**

**Establish strong relationships in key & prospective clients to understand their priorities and the state of their business; use that knowledge to provide strategic recommendations that enable the overall success of their business.**

**Act as the primary point of contact for high-value global clients, ensuring delivery excellence and client satisfaction.**

**Provide strategic counsel on business transformation, leveraging domain and advanced technology expertise and emerging trends to solve critical business challenges.**

**Thought Leadership and Industry Influence**

**Leverage deep P&C domain expertise – spanning underwriting, pricing, claims, risk management, and digital transformation – to advise clients on innovation and operational efficiency.**

**Serve as an industry thought leader, representing the organization at global forums, conferences, and industry events.**

**Publish insights and lead discussions on cutting-edge topics such as AI, technology, data strategy, and digital transformation.**

**Keep teams and services apprised of relevant Insurance trends and opportunities that can add value to our clients and accelerate our growth.**

**Operational Excellence and Project Oversight**

**Operate with a practitioner mindset, overseeing the delivery of large-scale, complex advisory projects, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and client expectations.**

**Ensure operational efficiency by driving common advisory methodologies and frameworks, developing and driving best practices, and maintaining high standards of project delivery.**

**Drive resource efficiency and gross margin through the optimization of resource utilization.**

**Cross-functional and Global Collaboration**

**Work closely with global teams across various business units (e.g., finance, supply chain, technology) to deliver integrated solutions to clients.**

**Promote cross-border collaboration, leveraging global talent and capabilities to solve complex, multinational client problems.**

**Ensure seamless integration of services, balancing advisory services with technology, data, and industry expertise.**

**Collaborate with senior executives and board members to influence global decision-making, share insights, and help shape overall company strategy.**

**Act as a key advisor to the executive team on the latest trends in advanced technology and other emerging areas impacting business.**

**Team Leadership and Talent Development**

**Responsible for the full end-to-end lifecycle of entire team including hiring, onboarding, assessing, and evaluating performance and exiting team members.**

**Provide leadership to the team through coaching, mentoring, and development of staff.**

**Consult with leadership and HR on sensitive and difficult employee situations and issues.**

**Build meaningful relationships and community within the team.**

**Ensure new staff are trained in an efficient and effective way.**

**Qualifications we seek in you!**

**Minimum Qualifications**

**Bachelor's or Master's** **degree / MBA in one of the following disciplines: business, finance, supply chain, accounting, analytics, engineering, technology,** **GenAI** **or data management; MBA preferred.**

**Extensive track record in a leadership position, within a consulting or advisory organization, driving transformation for large organizations.**

**Deep understanding of the P&C insurance ecosystem, including underwriting modernization, claims optimization, policy administration, regulatory trends and digital disruption.**

**Thorough understanding of advanced technology and analytical trends including AI, machine learning, cloud computing and enterprise technology systems.**

**Strong leadership, vision-setting, and strategic thinking skills. Proven ability to guide high-level strategy across complex, global environments.**

**Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to influence C-suite executives and senior stakeholders.**

**Creative and forward-thinking in delivering technology solutions to business problems.**

**Ability to work effectively across diverse teams and business units, integrating various disciplines to deliver holistic client solutions.**

**Preferred Qualifications/ Skills**

**Proven experience managing global, cross-functional teams and delivering solutions across multiple geographies.**

**Demonstrated success in growing a business unit, service line, or practice through innovation, client relationships, and market understanding.**

**Experience effectively influencing C-level customers and internal stakeholders.**

**Excellent problem solver, hyper logical and goal-oriented thinker.**

**Excellent presentation skills – in person & virtually.**

**Able to create and maintain relationships easily.**

**Ability to thrive in ambiguity.**

***Why join Genpact?***

***Be a transformation leader*** ***– Work at the cutting edge of AI, automation, and digital innovation***

***Make an impact*** ***– Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter***

***Accelerate your career*** ***– Get hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning opportunities***

***Work with the best*** ***– Join 140,000+ bold thinkers and problem-solvers who push boundaries every day***

***Thrive in a values-driven culture*** ***– Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness - built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion - allow your ideas to fuel progress***

***Come join the tech shapers and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up.***

***Let’s build tomorrow together.***

***The approximate annual base compensation range for this position is [$200,000 to $250,000]. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package plus benefits, will be determined by*** ***a number of*** ***factors which include but are not limited to the applicant’s experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities; geographic location; and internal equity***

**Work-from-Anywhere Roles** **– “Los Angeles California-based candidates are not eligible for this role”**

**Location-based Roles** **(*****e.g., New York roles – metro area can be adjusted by role location)*** **– “Los Angeles, California based candidates are not eligible for this role. <New York> area candidates are eligible for this role only.”**

***Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race,*** ***color******, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.***  
***Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.***

jobs.title: Director of Client Advisory
jobs.description:
**About RDC.AI**

What started in 2016 with five people and two chairs has become a global force transforming how banks lend, grow, and protect their portfolios. RDC.AI helps business and commercial bankers know more, do more, and grow more by turning complex data into actionable intelligence. Our platform uniquely combines predictive and agentic AI to deliver transparent, explainable insights across the entire lending lifecycle - from origination to monitoring. With built-in AI assistants and clear rationales for every recommendation, we empower banks across the globe to make confident decisions faster, launch innovative products, and generate tens of millions of dollars in measurable value. We're not just building AI - we're pioneering the future of intelligent banking, where every decision is explainable, every insight is actionable, and every outcome drives real impact.
  
  
**Join the AI Revolution** **Award-Winning Innovation**

* Winner: The Digital Banker's 2025 Global AI Innovation Awards (Best AI-Powered Platform)
* Two-time finalist: American Chamber of Commerce Alliance Awards (Advanced Capabilities category)

**Cutting-Edge Technology**

* Building agentic AI solutions that solve real world banking problems
* We are live in major banks, making millions of decisions, generating tens of millions in value
* Highest security accreditations: SOC2 Type 2 and ISO 27001 certified

**5-Star Employer Experience**

* Named "Best Companies to Work For" by HRD Australia (2023)
* High-performance teams working alongside industry-leading data scientists and credit experts
* Vibrant, innovative culture that celebrates wins and solves complex problems together

**Global Impact & Growth**

* Fast-expanding presence across Australia, New Zealand, and North America
* Helping drive financial inclusion through fair, accessible, sustainable credit
* Opportunity to gain AI expertise and international experience in a rapidly growing market

**Work-Life Excellence**

* Highly flexible working arrangements - work how's right for you
* Collaborative, agile environment where your contributions matter
* Be part of a mission that's transforming financial services globally

**RDC.AI North America offers:**

* Competitive benefits package (80% of premiums paid by RDC.ai)
* 12 paid holidays
* 20 days PTO per year + 5 paid personal or sick days per year
* Paid Maternity/Paternity leave

  

**Ready to shape the future of intelligent banking? Join us.**

  

**About the Role**

RDC.AI is a cloud native AI Decisioning company focusing on Business and Commercial Lending Institutions. The Client Advisor is a pivotal part of our success. A Client Advisor combines their deep Credit domain knowledge within Business and Commercial Lending to solve complex credit problems using data, AI and software. This role works closely with prospects, clients, partners, and multiple internal parties, and bridges the gap between business and technology to produce unique solutions that customers love. This role is the human equivalent of the Swiss Army Knife; and operates over many parts of the RDC.AI’s value chain – product management, product marketing, sales, customer delivery & customer support. The role has a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive sales, delivery and product development at high speed to ensure RDC.AI consistently has a suite of cutting edge and well sought after business solutions to remain at the forefront of competition. The role will involve the following key activities, and support in the following areas:

**Pre-sales**

* Use your deep Business & Commercial Lending domain experience to build rapport with prospects and users of our platform and behave at the highest level when engaging with enterprise clients.
* Build content and messaging with videos, demos, etc. to show the world how awesome our solutions are.
* Assist with product demonstrations, RFP’s by utilizing your Lending expertise
* Partner with sales to ensure they have everything they need to convert leads to sales.
* Enable meaningful engagement with prospects and existing customers

**Delivery**

* Work closely with the Delivery Team to ensure they clearly understand and communicate the details they need to turn customers visions into real life deployments.
* Act as the SME on delivery when required and showcase your world-class knowledge of Lending in Business and Commercial banking, specifically in the North America market.
* Leverage data, and lending industry experience to develop credit lending strategies, and actionable value-based decision science solutions.
* Gather, analyze, and document customer needs, to drive the demonstrated product capabilities, and drive future direction of the software platform.

**Execution of Product Enablement**

* Align product understanding for internal teams
* Identifying market problems and create stories, use cases, and solutions within Business and Commercial banking
* Follow the Pragmatic Framework approach to product management and marketing particularly assisting / supporting the stages of Programs, Readiness, and Support

  

**About the Candidate**

**Essential-Experience/Skills**

* 10+ years of Business and Commercial banking experience within North America
* 5+ years of experience in decisioning & decisioning/AI software in the context of Business & Commercial Lending
* Experience in presenting to Senior Banking audiences including C-Suite in North America
* Experience with product management and development methodologies
* Financial services understanding and experience, ideally lending- focused within Business & Commercial Banking.
* AI, specifically Machine Learning, Agentic AI understanding or experience
* Experience of leading teams across geographical regions and industries
* Stakeholder management and negotiation skills
* Work autonomously, in cross-functional team, and in virtual teams globally
* Knowledge of product capabilities, features and roadmap
* Ability to define, investigate and execute complex solution designs
* Excellent written and verbal skills
* Ability to travel within North America and to HQ in Australia (estimated 50% travel)

  

**Desired-Experience/Skills**

* Understanding of Enterprise software, Software as a Service, data integration, etc.
* Ability to position value and security of Cloud deployment
* Sales Process Acumen and participation in opportunity planning
* Solution configuration and demonstration, that meets customers environment and requirements
* Ability to participate in outbound prospecting

  

**\*\*We have a location preference of New York City, but may be open to San Jose, CA for the right candidate.**

jobs.title: Book Keeper- Part Time
jobs.description:
Daniel Humm Hospitality is an award-winning restaurant group made up of Eleven Madison Park, Clemente Bar, and Eleven Madison Home. We have built a strong culture with an emphasis on supporting our employees and encouraging their growth and development. We take our work seriously, without taking ourselves too seriously. Always trying to reinvent, we are creative, spontaneous and not afraid to take risks.

We are looking for an **Part Time Bookkeeper** to assist with the day-to-day accounting needs in our headquarters office. This opportunity can transition to full time as projects come online in the upcoming year.

**Schedule:** Onsite, Monday, Wednesday and Friday (9AM–5 PM) or Monday through Friday (9AM-2PM) (24/25 hours per week)

**Reports to:** Chief Financial Officer

**Duties and Responsibilities**

**Accounts Payable**

* Receive, process and verify all invoices
* Import invoices into accounting software
* File invoices and match credit memos when needed
* Print weekly check run for three businesses
* Match checks with invoices to ensure accuracy before mailing
* Mail accounts payable checks
* Upload check batches to bank website
* Check vendor statements monthly and find missing invoices, if needed
* Establish and maintain positive and productive vendor relationships
* Ensure compliance with accounting controls and procedures
* Respond to vendor emails as needed
* Set up new vendor accounts as needed

**Cash and Credit Card Handling**  

* Reconcile cash sales and cash tips and create bank deposits for pickup
* Create cash banks for daily bar tills
* Maintain petty cash bank
* Organize daily guest receipts
* Reconcile tip amounts from POS system with tip sheets to ensure accuracy for payroll
* Assist in pulling necessary information to respond to chargebacks

**Requirements for Success:**

* Well-organized with a keen attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively
* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite
* Comfortable with basic IT and electronic equipment
* Prior work in accounting within hospitality is a plus
* Ability to lift up to 15 pounds

This job description above does not list each and every job responsibility of a Staff Accountant. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned as necessary.

More detail about Eleven Madison Park part of Daniel Humm Hospitality

jobs.title: Contract Security Officer - Full Time ($38.04)
jobs.description:
Contract Security Officer - Full Time ($38.04)

The Contract Security Officer(CSO) position will be responsible for safe guarding assigned location(s) and possess knowledge of security SOP standards. The CSO must all be able to effectively communicate with a diverse range of individuals, including members of the general public, Department of Defense personnel, and all ranks of military, civilians, and visitors.

* The duties and responsibilities are as followed, but not limited to:
* + Security of building(s)
  + Identification of all visitors and guests
  + Protection of physical assets
  + Anti-terrorism and force protection
  + Maintaining logs via written or electronic
  + Maintaining and carrying a firearm

This position is under the direct supervision of the Site Captain and Lieutenant.

**Candidate Qualifications:**

* Must be a U.S. Citizen
* Must Be 21 years of age
* Must be able to comply with grooming and uniform standards
* Must be high school/GED graduate
* Must posses a clearance issued by U.S. Department of Defense

Must have one of the following:

* Three years armed security experience OR
* Three years of military service (active duty or reserve) with and honorable discharge OR
* An Associates Degree or at least 60 semester hours of college coursework in any field of study OR
* Successful completion of Police Officer's Standard Training (POST) course

Also:

* Armed DCJS License is required
* We can help you obtain your Virginia State license w/firearms endorsement, by providing the required training.

**Additional Eligibility Qualifications:**

* The applicant is required to submit to pre-employment medical exam and drug screening.
* The applicant must be able to successfully meet the height and weight requirements as set forth by the governing contract.
* The applicant must be able to pass an NCIC / State / Local Background check and Credit check.
* The applicant must be able to attend and complete all required training prior to assignment.
* The applicant must be able to successfully complete a Physical Agility Test.
* The applicant must be able to successfully complete a Firearms Qualification.

**AAP/EEO Statement**

The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) has issued guidance referencing employers are allowed to mandate COVID-19 vaccinations for in-person employees. The Federal Equal Employment Opportunity laws additionally allow an employer to legally require all employees that report to a physical workplace to be vaccinated for COVID-19, except where an employer must provide a "reasonable accommodation" under Title VII or the ADA.

S1S is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

**EOE Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran: S1S is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer and an Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace.**

Security 1 Solutions is committed to our core mission: To be the leading security solutions provider in the cleared security industry. We are driven by our personal and professional commitment to our customers, our employees, and our community.

Daily, we are meeting our mission requirements by consistently demonstrating a high level of ethical behavior, professional honesty and mutual respect with everyone we contact. We ‘listen’ to our customers and employees and implement ‘workable solutions’ in order to improve service-delivery.

Security 1 Solutions will continue to seek new and innovative methods to achieve our vision, our mission and goals.

jobs.title: Aviation Contracts Manager
jobs.description:
**GA Telesis** is a global leader providing integrated solutions to the aviation and aerospace industries, with a continuously expanding presence in new countries worldwide. We serve over 2,000 customers, including airlines, original equipment manufacturers, maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) providers. GA Telesis Ecosystem™ is a vast global network spanning 54 locations in 30 countries on six continents. At GA Telesis, our core business is integrated aviation solutions, and our mission is customer success.  
  
The Asset Management Team is seeking a high-energy, self-motivated **Aviation Contract Manager** to join our Asset Management Team. Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the ideal candidate should be detail-oriented, a team player, reliable, proactive, decisive, adaptable, and able to solve problems with a bias towards action to keep transactions moving in a positive direction. This role is based onsite in Fort Lauderdale, FL.  
  
**\*\*Important Notice**:  
Eligibility Requirement: Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. The company does not provide visa sponsorship or accept candidates requiring sponsorship

**Responsibilities:**

* Draft letters of Intent (“LOI”) for the purpose of acquiring, leasing, or selling aviation assets.
* Manage tracking of drafted LOIs and stages of comment/approval/issuance/signing.
* Coordinate with internal departments, including commercial, technical, legal, tax, and finance, throughout LOI drafting review, and signing.
* Assist the Asset Management Team and participate in the planning, processing, and closing of transactions.
* Review and recommend revisions to procedures to procedures to maintain excellence in transaction processing.
* Review and recommend revisions to procedures to maintain excellence in transaction processing.
* Participate and provide input to transaction documents, including, but not limited to, lease agreements and purchase agreements.
* Provide general assistance with other contract management needs within the Asset Management Team.

**Qualifications:**

* 3 years experience of in commercial contracts, project management, and transactions
* Tactical and strategic thinker
* Proficient in MS Office
* Excellent communicator
* Excellent organizational and time management skills; performs well under pressure
* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Paralegal experience preferred

  
Check out how GA Telesis is "Intelligently Defining the FUTURE of Aviation and Aerospace" by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook!

jobs.title: Bus Driver (part time)
jobs.description:
**Position Information**
------------------------

Position Information

**Vacancy Number:**

S-01251

  

**Position Title:**

Bus Driver (part time)

  

**Classification Title:**

  

**Department:**

Financial and Administrative Services

  

**Employment Type:**

Part-Time

  

**Special Instructions to Applicants:**

Auburn University at Montgomery reserves the right once interviewing has begun to stop accepting applications.

  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Safely drive a 12-46 passenger bus from campus to locations off-campus on a regular schedule.
* Operate passenger shuttle on a scheduled route from campus to off-campus locations.
* Operate bus on special trips as scheduled.
* Perform daily inspections as required.
* Fill gas tank when needed.
* Promptly report maintenance issues.
* Assist passengers with physical deficits on and off of vehicle, ensuring safe transport.
* Keep record of passenger numbers and/or log-book as required.
* Perform all other duties assigned by the Chief Campus Services Officer.
* Complete all pre and post-trip inspections.
* Enforce federal, state and University guidelines for bus riders.
* Perform additional duties as assigned by management.

  

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Knowledge of highway regulations
* Knowledge of how to deal with patrons
* Knowledge of how to deal with individuals with special needs
* Knowledge of scheduling system and procedures
* Knowledge of record keeping system
* Knowledge of equipment cleaning standards and procedures
* Ability to provide a safe, clean, and comfortable transportation for students.
* Ability to maintain a commitment to the safety of the students, drivers, motorists, cyclists, pedestrians.
* Skill in driving
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Decision making skills
* Team building skills
* Stress management skills
* Time management skills
* Analytical and problem solving skills
* Customer service and public interaction skills
* Ability to perform daily inspection of shuttle and ensure all preventive and scheduled maintenance are conducted.
* Ability to work independently with little to no direct supervision.
* Ability to be responsible, dependable, and punctual.
* Ability to demonstrate excellent customer service.
* Ability to exercise judgment and operate under time pressure.
* Able to speak and read English to converse with students.
* Ability and willingness to follow traffic regulations.
* Ability to adhere to strict daily route schedules.
* Able to work flexible hours.
* Ability to operate a bus in a safe and responsible manner
* Ability to read and write to record pickups and maintain daily records
* Ability to comprehend written material

  

**Minimum Qualifications:**

High School Diploma or equivalent and two (2) years of experience in driving a bus is required. A Commercial Driver’s License (CDL) with a 24 plus passenger endorsement is required. Previous or current public transportation or experience with large passenger vehicles is preferred.  
  
An offer of employment is contingent on passing a pre-employment background check, passing a pre-employment drug/alcohol screening, and meeting the Department of Motor Vehicles’ vision requirements.

  

**Job Open Date:**

01/23/2026

  

**This posting will remain open until closed:**

Yes

  

**Job Close Date:**

Located in Alabama’s vibrant state capital, Auburn University at Montgomery is a fast-growing university on the rise. Don’t just take our word for it: The Princeton Review rates us as one of the best colleges in the Southeast, while U.S. News & World Report recently ranked us No. 22 among regional universities in the South for the quality of undergraduate teaching and 38th among all public institutions in the region.

jobs.title: Part-Time Safety and Facility Support Associate
jobs.description:
**POSITION TITLE:** **Safety and Facility Support- Part-time**  
**REPORTS TO:** Chief Operating Officer
  
**BROAD FUNCTION:**Promotes safety, and provides facility and operations support at agency locations
  
  
**I. PROFESSIONALISM:**

* Values and participates in the Team as a proactive member.
* Respects others’ professional opinions and tolerates a range of feelings.
* Able to give and receive constructive criticism.

**II. SUPERVISION:**

* Attends supervision consistently and comes prepared.
* Able to receive feedback and to learn from it.
* Has insight about self (i.e., strengths and weaknesses) and utilizes that knowledge toward growth and change.

**III. SAFETY AND FACILITY SUPPORT:**

* Respond to emergent or escalating situations, as a part of a team, to promote de-escalation, safety, and indicated follow-up.
* Proactively respond to situations, with a goal of preventing an emergent or escalating situation.
* Promote the safety and well-being of our staff and consumers by supporting entry and exit from the building, waiting area space, and outside grounds/parking lot, through following agency procedures.
* Daily review of the building and grounds for any upkeep, repairs or hazards, communication, and support of the resolution of repairs and hazards.
* Submission of work orders for repairs or other appropriate maintenance in response to anything identified from #4 above.
* Support Facilities Support Specialist with facility needs as requested.
* Complete formal quarterly facility safety checklist.
* Assist with quarterly/annual fire and emergency drills for facility.
* Assist with Front Desk coverage as needed.
* Cleaning of the building and grounds as needed to support high client volume or as needed to support other facility support staff being out.
* Receive packages that come into the facility and deliver to staff within building.
* Assist with vehicle maintenance and upkeep, taking vehicles for maintenance, DMV, or to support program needs.

  
**SPECIFICATIONS:**

* **Education:** High School Diploma or equivalent
* **Experience:** Two or more years working in a safety/security role. Experience cleaning in a business environment. Valid driver’s license in good standing and experience with local and highway driving.
* **Skills and Abilities:** Good oral communication skills. Ability to create a warm, caring, non-threatening atmosphere. Willingness to work with individuals from diverse backgrounds. Possesses an understanding of professional ethics and issues of confidentiality. Ability to work on a multi-disciplinary team. Driver’s license and record in good standing.
* **Professional Characteristics:** The individual is warm, open, empathic, attentive listener, self-aware, ethical, creative, organized, flexible, open to criticism, patient, responsible, able to work independently, mature, self-motivated, dedicated, enthusiastic, willing to take on additional tasks and responsibilities, and interested in seeking additional training and skills.

**Pay Rate:** $20 - $22/hr.  
  
**Vacation & Benefits:**

* Vacation: As a full-time employee working generally 35 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the Family Connections group benefit plans. Benefits include medical, dental, life insurance, long term disability, retirement plans, and additional supplementary benefits. Yes, you can elect to not enroll into these benefits. You will also be eligible to accrue vacation, personal, and sick days in addition to 12 paid holidays, and summer wellness Fridays.
* Benefits also include professional development assistance, referral program, internal/external trainings, Capella University partnership, 403b retirement plan with employer matching (3% max) (you can enroll in your 403b without a waiting period) , employer-paid life insurance, employer paid Long-term Disability (LTD) insurance, employer paid Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, etc.

* **Work Environment/Physical Demands:** The individual must possess the ability to perform work that requires frequent standing, bending, reaching, squatting, kneeling, moving, and lifting of up to or in excess of 50 pounds.
* *The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job or that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

Family Connections is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to excellence. Employment offers are made on the basis of qualifications and without regard to race, sex, religion, national or ethnic origin, disability, age veteran status, or sexual orientation or other protected classes under the State and Federal law.

jobs.title: US Growth Marketing Lead (12 month contract)
jobs.description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

Trustpilot is entering an exciting new phase of growth in the United States. As we continue to scale our presence and impact, we are looking for a US Growth Marketing Lead to help execute and accelerate our B2B and B2C marketing efforts in North America.

This is a 12 month contract, reporting to the VP of US Marketing, with the potential to convert to a permanent role.

This role sits at the center of the US marketing engine, focused on executing high-impact, data-driven marketing programs across the B2B buyer journey, while supporting post-sale adoption, engagement, and expansion. You will partner closely with US Commercial, RevOps, and Global Marketing teams to ensure marketing activity is aligned to commercial priorities and market opportunities.

You will also support the growth of Trustpilot's consumer brand presence in the US, contributing to earned and owned initiatives, and helping activate B2B customers as advocates who amplify Trustpilot's value through their own channels.

While this role does not include direct people management, you will act as a senior individual contributor and functional leader within US Marketing, providing guidance, collaboration, and support to junior and mid-level team members, and contributing to a high-performing, outcomes-focused team culture.

  

**What you'll be doing:**

* ### **Drive revenue growth in North America by leading B2B marketing initiatives that significantly expand Trustpilot's presence, awareness, and penetration in a high-potential market.**
* ### **Ensure message consistency and channel orchestration across all marketing channels (paid digital, webinar and in-person events, content, lifecycle, email nurture).**
* Design high-impact pulse campaigns around global product announcements and key tentpole moments.
* Accelerate Commercial outcomes by delivering high-quality MQLs, pipeline creation/acceleration, and marketing-attributed revenue across SMB, Mid-Market, and Enterprise segments.
* Build out the US events strategy (sponsored, owned, in-person, digital)
* Manage US Marketing program budget
* Rigorously set targets, track progress, report on outcomes, and learn and adapt from insights
* Develop and scale programs that activate B2B customers to amplify our brand, tell their stories, and advocate for Trustpilot
* Initiate innovative B2B2C activations that leverage the reach of our B2B customers' own audiences to grow Trustpilot brand awareness and affinity among US consumers
* Provide strategic direction, mentorship, and prioritization guidance to the US marketing team

* Help shape a high-performance culture centered on clarity, accountability, and measurable impact.

* Own US reporting, analytics, and performance insights to guide investment decisions and optimize outcomes.
* Apply market and competitive intelligence to sharpen US positioning and messaging.

**Who you are:**

* A strong track record of driving B2B SaaS marketing performance, including lead generation, pipeline growth, revenue outcomes, and customer expansion.
* Experience creating and deploying successful Consumer brand campaigns, particularly via B2B2C motions
* Exceptional strategic thinking, with the ability to balance brand-building and performance-driven execution, especially in the face of ambiguity.
* Experience leading multi-channel, full-funnel marketing programs in a highly competitive landscape.
* Deep understanding of US go-to-market dynamics and the unique competitive pressures of the US B2B SAAS market, especially within the context of AEO/GEO and LLMs.
* Proven ability to influence senior stakeholders and guide cross-functional teams without direct reporting lines.
* Outstanding communication skills — capable of representing Trustpilot externally and crafting narratives that resonate with US businesses and consumers.
* Analytical rigor with a passion for turning insights into measurable commercial outcomes.
* Adaptability, decisiveness, and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, rapidly scaling environment.
* A passion for Trustpilot's mission and a commitment to building a symbol of trust for the AI era.

  

**What's in it for you:**

  

* A competitive base salary ranging from $170,000 to $190,000 gross per year. This range doesn't include any variable pay such as bonuses, awards made under Trustpilot's equity program or other benefits
* A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
* 20 vacation days + 2 personal days +10 paid holidays per year
* Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
* Rich learning and development opportunities supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
* Full health insurance
* 401k matching your contributions dollar-for-dollar up to 4% of your base salary
* Discounted club membership at Life Time Fitness
* 24/7 Employee Assistance Plan and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
* Paid parental leave for employees who have been employed for over 6 months with full scope of benefit after 12 months
* Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities and team socials
* A friendly, open office complete with a foosball table, roof deck with wifi (rooftop meeting anyone?!) and unlimited snacks and drinks
* Communal lunch, extra treats and events during the month — think ice cream carts, coffee bars and massages, to name a few

**Still not sure?**

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We're excited to hear about your experiences along with how you will contribute to our working culture. Even if you don't feel you meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

#LI-SH1

**About us**

  

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we're headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We're driven by connection. It's at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it's built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we're proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We're a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you're ready to grow, let's go.

**Join us at the heart of trust.**

*Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.*

*Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our* *Privacy Policy.*  
  
*If you have a disability and would like to discuss any adjustments you might need either in submitting your application, or to the recruitment process more generally, please let us know by contacting our Talent Acquisition Team (talent.acquisition@trustpilot.com)* *quoting the role you wish to apply for.*  
  
*Any offer of employment for this position will be subject to our standard background checks.*
